title: Technical Business Analyst (Clinical Oncology Studies)
description:
**Working** under the direction of the Clinical Director, **the Business Analyst** will have a key role and be responsible for aligning our information technology systems with business operations by analyzing and developing innovative integrated software solutions, including Real World Data/ AI for oncology clinical trials and clinical trial management systems. **BA will work with staff and be looked upon to discuss workings in "plain English"**  Duties include providing internal IT support and managing web-based services and internal customer support for the Coalition and its affiliated entities

**This is a hybrid position requiring 1-2 days/week working from our Center City Philadelphia office.**

**JOB REQUIREMENTS**

**Skills/Abilities**

The Business Analyst’s role requires the following:

* Exemplary interpersonal, communication and education skills toward facilitating the use of new software systems
* This role necessitates self-direction, motivation, organization, strict attention to detail and problem solving and decision making abilities
* Knowledge of a CTMS\CTMF
* Knowledge of clinical database study build is a plus
* Advanced knowledge of programming languages like SQL, MS Access and system integration solutions

**Experience**

* A minimum of five (5) years of experience working in the field of computer systems programming; operations; systems, data base or network enterprise system support (hardware or software level); or information technology management consulting.
* Experience working in a CRO or Pharmaceutical Clinical Trial environment.
* Extensive experience in technical business analysis in a related industry.
* Able to facilitate internal end-user proficiency.
* Able to design and maintain efficient customer portal support and feedback channels.
* Advanced knowledge of data security and encryption.
* Able to keep up with IT advancements.
* Knowledge of relevant licensing and industry compliance regulations

**Education**

* A Bachelor’s Degree with a major in computer science, electronics or management information systems and or relevant professional experience is required.
* An accreditation in management consultancy preferred

**Responsibilities:**

* Performs system analyses on software programs, applications, and web services and makes recommendations for necessary changes or upgrades.
* Acts as the liaison with collaborators and vendors, internal departments and clinical sites to ensure system viability and user familiarity and proficiency.
* Works with staff to develop and deliver all appropriate and necessary reports.
* Works with key departments to ensure and maintain relevant efficiencies within the system.
* Assists management with identifying areas of improvement and enhancements and obtains approval for system development projects.
* Efficiently integrates new systems, programs, and applications with business operations and services.
* Analyzes and improves the performance of web-based customer portals and support services.
* Monitors product licenses and ensures compliance with IT industry regulations.
* Ensures that computer hardware remains compatible with system enhancements and updates.
* Participates in on-going continuing education courses or seminars.

title: Database Manager
company: Central Association of the Miraculous Medal
description:
**JOB SUMMARY:**

Reporting to the Vice President, Institutional Advancement, the Database Manager will manage the Raisers Edge NXT and Raisers Edge Database View donor fundraising solutions. In conjunction with the CEO and VPs of all departments, the Database Manager will be responsible for database management and administration, including data integrity, all reporting needs, training of advancement staff, database security, and working closely with outside vendors to maintain and improve internal business process workflows.

**JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:**  
• Maintain database integrity and accuracy.  
• Perform and/or oversee all gift processing duties in a timely manner, including but not limited to gift entry, gift acknowledgements, pledge reminders, matching gifts, and the committed gifts feed to finance.  
• Work closely with Finance department to ensure that accurate data is shared between accounting software and Raiser’s Edge NXT. Pull all necessary reports for Finance and work closely with them on annual audit to ensure reconciliation.  
• Work closely with Events and Beyond Sunday team to process all data and information and extract information as requested.  
• Extract financial reports and lists for CEO when requested, both Ad hoc and standard reports.  
• Provide Marketing with updated mailing lists for direct mail and digital communications and populate constituent records with applicable Appeals.  
• Coordinate with IT and outside IT vendors to make sure Raiser’s Edge NXT is connected to and exchanging information with all add-on software programs, and that the fundraising solution is being updated by Blackbaud regularly.  
• Work with Gift Shop to regularly update inventory and new items and process all sales information to constituent records if necessary.  
• Work closely with outside direct mail vendors to provide and proof targeted segments for monthly mailings and populate constituent records with applicable Appeals.  
• Serve as primary point of contact for Blackbaud as it relates to the Raiser’s Edge NXT  
• Gather and organize data for all grant applications.  
• Monitor and report on all fundraising goals and progress using the Raiser’s Edge NXT standard reports, Report Builder, and Dashboards.  
• Contact and work with donors when required to update the Raiser’s Edge NXT database.  
• Serve in outward-facing capacity at CAMM events when needed.  
• Provide regular reports on data and software management at Director’s meetings.  
• Regularly train CAMM staff to ensure all can fully and properly utilize the database withing their permissions rights, and privileges.  
• Create and maintain a Policy and Procedures manual for the Raiser’s Edge NXT, including gift entry, acknowledgments, and the Feed to Finance.  
• Participate regularly in strategy meetings with CEO and VP of Institutional Advancement.  
• Work weekends and nights when required.  
• Attend training seminars and conventions when required.  
• Performs other duties and projects as assigned.

**EDUCATION:**  
• Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience.

**EXPERIENCE:**  
• Experience with Blackbaud is preferred.  
• Five to seven years of relevant experience.  
• Experience in working with donors.  
• A comprehensive understanding of Advancement Services as a functional area.

**KNOWLEDGE:**  
• Basic understanding of Catholic faith.  
• Competency using Microsoft Office Suite.

**SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS:**  
• Familiarity with fundraising and/or non-profit enterprises.  
• Excellent oral and written communication skills.  
• Strong organizational and persuasion skills.  
• Ability to train staff in Raisers Edge, Raisers Edge NXT, and Financial Edge.  
• Ability to work independently.  
• People-oriented with a natural and innate desire to connect and build relationships.  
• Ability to communicate effectively with technical and non-technical staff.

title: Site Administrator Technician III
description:
**Signing Bonus Included**

 

Under the direction of the Field Service Manager but working largely independently without and/or limited direct supervision, The Site Administration Technician 3 will provide remedial repair, preventive maintenance, and system reliability services. Potentially administer kiosk collection/service activities with customers located geographically throughout an assigned territory.

**Responsibilities include:**

• Serve as a positive Ambassador representative for company when meeting with customers and clients – clearly demonstrating “Service Excellence”

• Responsible for overall service of company products at assigned customer sites and willing to assist the customer at all times

• Prioritizing and planning of assigned service calls

• Communicating updates associated with assigned service calls

• Escalating problems when appropriate

• Interacting in a professional manner with customers to foster positive relationships

• Point of contact for FACILITY staff for any issues regarding customer account

• Replacing telephony hardware and network components, basic maintenance practices

• Pulling cable, mounting network devices, installing telephony hardware

• Administer kiosk service and collections, clearing bill/paper jams, and deposit monies at assigned financial institutions

• Basic troubleshooting to include defining problems, collecting data, establishing facts, and drawing valid conclusions; assisting Technical Support departments with corrective action on deployed hardware and software; developing working knowledge of all operating standards, practices, and procedures

• Wiring troubleshooting to include tracing and repairing or replacing damaged wiring and effecting repairs on 66-Blocks or Cutoff Switches

• Handle special projects as assigned by Field Service Manager

• Scheduled and/or unscheduled overtime work and callouts are to be expected

• Energize and foster an effective and impactful team environment

• Troubleshoot video visitation session issues with guidance from company Technical Support where applicable

• Perform basic troubleshooting of tablet functionality, applications, and Wi-Fi connectivity issues where applicable

• Return damaged or inoperable equipment in accordance with company Return Merchandise Authorization process

 

**Qualifications, Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:**

• High school diploma or general education degree (GED) is required.

• Minimum of 2-4 years of related experience.

• Experience troubleshooting, ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions.

• Proficient in Windows OS, MS Office, and other software programs that may be required

• Proficient with Telephony and Networking, inclusive of copper, CAT 5/6, and fiber optic wiring

• Knowledge of wiring color code and fabrication of data cabling.

• Must be able to frequently lift and/or move up to 10 pounds and occasionally lift and/or move up to 100 pounds with assistance.

• Must possess a valid driver’s license. The willingness and ability to travel to various customer sites daily with the potential for overnight trips

• The work atmosphere will be relevant with access to government agencies, jail, and prison environments, with stringent security guidelines to be maintained at-all-times

• Ability and willingness to work the scheduled and/or unscheduled overtime work assignments and after-hours callouts.

• Valid driver’s license and good driving record

title: Treasury Operations Associate
description:
**Overview**

The Treasury Operations Associate supports the treasury and banking activity of the American Bible Society and the Faith and Liberty Discovery Center, LLC. Primary duties include lockbox and transaction processing and supporting banking, vendor, and internal relationships. You may also assist in the execution of daily cash management duties for accounts receivable and accounts payable.

**Job duties/Responsibilities**

 **Lockbox Processing**: 45%

* Process all local lockbox transactions for ABS and FLDC.
* Deposit checks and cash using remote deposit capture (RDC) software.
* Perform special processing for MICR failed checks, damaged checks, and foreign currency checks.
* Batch and journalize all local lockbox activities for ABS and FLDC.
* Process and reconcile transactions in accordance with internal controls.
* Support bank reconciliation for demand deposit accounts (DDAs).
* Support credit card processing and payment processing services.
* Extract all remittances/donations from marketing appeals and corporate mail.

 **Transaction Processing**: 25%

* Review daily treasury reports and identify actionable items, including positive pay decisions.
* Prepare weekly reconcilement and journaling for FLDC’s cash tickets and merchandize sales.
* Create spreadsheet journals for donations, endowment income distributions, royalties, employee reimbursements, miscellaneous cash flows and bank reconciliation adjustments.
* Process intercompany transfers between ABS and FLDC as directed.
* Enter weekly Fedwire transfers as well as single ACH payments as directed.
* Generate monthly trial balance and perform variance analysis for accuracy and data integrity.
* Support month-end close by assisting with research and reclasses as directed.
* Prepare credit card adjustments for online donations as directed.

 **Banking, Caging Vendor and Ministry Advancement (MA) Relations**: 20%

* Maintain positive banking relationship with the treasury services at depository banks.
* Support the bank account management during the onboarding and offboarding process.
* Maximize the treasury portal’s dashboard for timely reporting and effective communication.
* Maintain positive relationship with ABS’s caging vendor to effectively process inbound donations.
* Attend weekly meetings with caging vendor and relationship marketing team to provide feedback on the workflow and provide positive recommendations for improvement.
* Support the Customer Relationship Management (CRM) workflow for accuracy and data integrity.
* Provide daily cash receipts email to data team within two business days of deposit and respond to exceptions promptly.
* Communicate large gifts promptly to expedite the acknowledgement process.
* Respond promptly to MA’s request for gift adjustments or research.

 **Other Responsibilities** 10%

* Assist with the daily cash positioning for ABS and FLDC.
* Assist with adjusting credit holds for accounts receivable when needed.
* Assist with the transactions for the mineral rights royalty program.
* Support MA’s fiscal year and calendar year gift processing testing for tax/audit purposes.

 

**Essential Skills/Traits**

* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
* Excellent organization and critical thinking skills.
* Ability to work collaboratively and independently.
* Ability to quickly grasp and understand transaction workflows.
* Ability to apply finance and treasury principles.
* MS office suite (**must have intermediary Excel skills**)
* Knowledge of banking industry and treasury platforms.
* Proficiency in general accounting principles.
* Knowledge of the Check Clearing for the 21st Century Act.
* Knowledge of Regulation E procedures for electronic funds transfers (EFTs).
* Knowledge of Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard (PCI DSS) protocol.
* Knowledge of Personal Identifiable Information (PII) protocols.

**Required Qualifications**

* Bachelor’s degree in accounting, business administration, economics, finance, or related field required.
* 3+ years of accounting or financial services experience.
* Retail banking/operations experience a plus.
* Prior teller or retail banking experience (a big plus).
* Accounting systems and Treasury software experience (a big plus).

title: Portfolio Administrator
description:
**SUMMARY DESCRIPTION:**

The incumbent is responsible for maintaining the quality, accuracy, and integrity of client information and data in the various systems used by Logan Capital Management, Inc. - eMoney, Salesforce software, & Clearwater Analytics are used for the maintenance and dissemination of client data, trading information, portfolio accounting, and reporting. Responsibilities encompass oversight of the electronic and physical records and files of the Operations area, and production and distribution of accurate client reports and quarterly statements. **This is an entry level position for the Administration team.**

 

**ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:** *may include any of the following. Other duties may also be assigned.*

· Transition new Equity and Fixed Income accounts by openings and preparing them for trading according to established parameters.

· Review contracts for client reporting requirements.

· Work with portfolio managers and traders to process recurring cash withdrawals for clients.

· Process closed accounts.

· Prepare, produce, and mail quarterly client statements.

· Maintain various files, records, and statistical reports which are related to above processing.

· Maintain client files under the firm’s records retention process.

· Maintain relationships with the client’s custodians, and master the custodian paperwork and systems to effect smooth account transactions and changes.

· Maintain knowledge of custodian system access for retrieving custody statements and reports.

· Setup new HNW clients, and maintain client data for existing HNW clients in eMoney.

· Stay abreast of the fiduciary rule, and assist relationship managers in the use of E-money to review their client’s financial plans, and help train clients on the use of E-money.

· Reconcile discrepancies between internal records and those of external custodian and vendors as needed.

· Interface with management to provide requested reports as needed.

· Interface with staff from other areas of the firm to ensure that all needs for accurate information and reports are met.

· Maintain process and procedure write-ups.

· Assist with operations process enhancements.

· Meet expectations for attendance and punctuality.

· Work overtime as required.

· Process and post data maintenance and account adjustment transactions in an accurate and timely manner according to established parameters.

· Maintain client proxy voting records.

· Identify and process internal data maintenance transactions in an accurate and timely manner according to established parameters.

· Maintain client descriptive data in various systems, and oversee the creation of functional reports to use data efficiently.

· Oversee the relationship with Logan Capital’s external reconciliation vendor. Ensure the proper processing and posting of daily account transactions based on electronically received custodial data, and direct custodian inquiries, according to established parameters.

· Liaise with Wrap Program Sponsors to ensure that all protocols for account instructions are documented and followed.

· Assist CCO with compliance record keeping

 

**QUALIFICATIONS:** *To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.*

· Fervent attention to detail.

· Ability to work well under pressure.

· Good interpersonal skills.

· Ability to work with supervision in a team environment.

· Strong organizational skills and the ability to plan, schedule, and execute activities and functions in a timely manner.

· Ability to manage multiple requests with appropriate prioritization, and follow up.

· Excellent oral/written communication ability.

· Strong ability with word processing, spreadsheet, database, and accounting software.

 

**EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE:**

· Bachelor's degree in an accounting, finance, information systems, or equivalent experience.

· Experience in the securities industry, in back office or portfolio administration area desired.

 

**PHYSICAL DEMANDS:** *The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.*

· Stands and/or sits for extended periods of time.

· Lifts boxes up to 40 pounds in weight.

title: Medical Billing Data Specialist
description:
**At Athelas and Commure, we're bringing simple, life-changing health care products and medical billing services to people around the globe.**

In addition to our established Remote Patient Monitoring business, we introduced a rapidly expanding SaaS Revenue Cycle Management solution in 2022 that provides revenue intelligence for hundreds of healthcare businesses from small clinics to large health systems. Our state-of-the-art dashboard, Athelas Insights, provides practices with an unparalleled understanding into their financial health to help them with all aspects of RCM, including eligibility, rejections, denials, as well as coding optimization and more.

To keep pace with our remarkable momentum - having seen a 5x increase in revenue over the past 6 months with more exponential growth on the horizon - we're actively seeking new, high-impact team members looking for a challenge!

Commure and Athelas have recently joined forces to form healthcare’s next-generation operating system. Through its pioneering AI-powered platform, the newly combined Commure gives time back to clinicians and staff at hospitals and health systems across the U.S. with easy-to-use clinical, financial, and operational solutions.

Together, we’re on a mission to connect, protect, and empower healthcare by developing groundbreaking and hyper-connected technologies. We believe deeply that by joining our many datasets and digital solutions together in harmony, we can solve our industry’s biggest challenges: improving the experiences of our care providers, bringing down the cost of care, and ensuring the health and wellbeing of our communities.

Combined, Commure and Athelas is backed by General Catalyst, Sequoia, Y Combinator, Lux, Human Capital, 8VC, Greenoaks Capital and Elad Gil.

If you want to improve healthcare innovation through close partnerships between developers and doctors, come work with us!

**Primary Responsibilities**

As a **Medical Billing Data Specialist**, you will be responsible for business office duties related to claims and payment processing, collections and data entry. This includes:

* 
Tracks client accounts for accuracy. Assists clients with billing questions, as needed, in a professional and courteous manner.

* 
Acts as a resource for other staff throughout agency and assists in orientation of new staff

* 
Provide backup to others as needed.


  
**Key Qualifications:**

* 
High school diploma or equivalent.

* 
Experience: 3+ years of medical billing experience.

+ 
Electronic and paper claim submission and medical billing experience

+ 
Knowledge of CPT, ICD-10, and HCPCS coding and third-party payor reimbursement methodologies, policies, and procedures.


* 
General accounting skills; ability to prepare billings, reconcile accounts receivable, and apply payments.

* 
Possess computer skills to efficiently operate accounts receivable software and to generate the proper reports needed.

* 
Strong attention to detail and have the ability to plan and organize work.

* 
Ability to communicate clearly, tactfully, and professionally to staff members and clients.

* 
Have flexibility to change, prioritize tasks, and work under pressure of meeting deadlines.


  
**Nice to Have:**

* 
Experience in OpenPM Software.

* 
Coding Certification, Health Information Management (HIM) degree.


**Why You’ll Like Working with Athelas**

* 
Execution focused, driven team: Join a team with an incredible record - we are the smallest, fastest company in history to receive FDA hematology clearance. We are also the largest Remote Patient Monitoring company in the US, with a fast-growing SaaS Revenue Cycle Management business as well

* 
Technology Focus: Revolutionizing how technology can be used in the healthcare industry

* 
Strong Backing: $132M Series B raised from the likes of Sequoia, General Catalyst, Tribe, Y Combinator

* 
Mission Driven: We are changing the way healthcare is provided, bringing it directly to the people who need it with technology-enabled solutions

* 
Incredible Growth: Revenue growth of 5x over the past 6 months and we're just getting started!

* 
Competitive Benefits: Unlimited PTO, medical, dental, vision, excellent maternity and paternity paid time off. 


Athelas is committed to creating and fostering a diverse team. We are open to all backgrounds and levels of experience, and believe that great people can always find a place. We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations to all applicants throughout the application process.  
  
Employees will act in accordance with the organization’s information security policies, to include but not limited to protecting assets from unauthorized access, disclosure, modification, destruction or interference nor execute particular security processes or activities. Employees will report to the information security office any confirmed or potential events or other risks to the organization. 

Employees will be required to attest to these requirements upon hire and on an annual basis.

title: VP of Data Management
description:
**Job Title:** Vice President of Data Management

**Location:** This role is based out of our Mount Laurel, NJ office on a hybrid work schedule. Remote candidates will be considered with frequent travel to the NJ office.

**Company Overview:** RetireeFirst is a rapidly growing healthcare company, where we're committed to making a positive impact on lives through top-tier coverage and exceptional support. We partner with the nation’s leading insurance providers to deliver cost-effective solutions while ensuring unparalleled support. If you're passionate about making a difference and thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative environment, apply to join us today.

**Position Overview:** RetireeFirst is seeking a highly skilled and visionary Vice President of Data Management to lead our data-driven initiatives.

As the Vice President of Data Management, you will be responsible for defining and operationalizing a data strategy, building roadmaps, defining architecture, instituting a continuous improvement lifecycle, and building a high performing team for a rapidly growing healthcare company. You will play a large role in shaping the future of the organization through data transformation that encompasses the way business divisions store, process, transmit and visualize data. You will be the key person responsible for getting value out of data we have and data we could have. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure data-driven decision-making, drive innovation, and enhance overall business performance through effective data management.

**Keys to success:** Over the first 90 days, the VP of Data Management will have:

* Established key relationships and gained intimate knowledge of the business.
* Formed a solid understanding of key processes around: implementations, eligibility, renewals, financial reporting, and call center service.
* Drafted a comprehensive strategy that includes data architecture, platform selection and team composition.
* Developed a point of view on future Data technology standards, with timelines, milestones, and business objectives.
* Drafted plans and timelines for implementation and transformation execution
* Have a strong point of view on Automation, AI capabilities, Health Data security, and Data privacy.
* Developed a roadmap of optimizing our CRM solution consumption and a point of view on the scalability of Salesforce as a solution.
* Developed KPI’s to measure success and continuous improvement.

**Key Responsibilities:**

**Data Strategy and Vision:**

1. Develop and communicate a clear data strategy aligned with organizational goals.
2. Define the vision for data management, ensuring it supports both short-term and long-term objectives.

**Data Architecture and Roadmap:**

1. Design and implement a scalable and efficient cloud data architecture to support the organization's data needs.
2. Define and implement strategic AI/ML capabilities to enhance capabilities and efficiencies.
3. Evaluate our current CRM solution (Salesforce) and develop a future CRM roadmap.
4. Ensure data security, privacy, integrity, and compliance with industry standards, contractual commitments, and regulations.

**Implementation and Execution:**

1. Lead the implementation of data initiatives, including data pipelines, data warehousing, and analytics platforms.
2. Secure the right resources, working through change in Salesforce capabilities and reporting capabilities.
3. Collaborate with IT and business teams to integrate data solutions into existing systems and processes.
4. Plan and execute business reporting improvements to introduce self service capabilities and efficient data reporting through Salesforce, Call Center systems, and a new data architecture.

**Continuous Improvement:**

1. Establish processes for ongoing data quality monitoring, data cleansing, and data enrichment.
2. Identify opportunities for continuous improvement and optimization of data-related processes.

**Team Leadership:**

1. Build and lead a high-performing data team, fostering a culture of innovation, collaboration, and excellence.
2. Keep Data management vendors and partners accountable for service delivery.
3. Provide mentorship and guidance to team members, promoting professional development.
4. Build relationships with key business stakeholders with the proper cadence, focusing on process improvement and service delivery.

**Key Skillsets:**

**Strategic Leadership:**

* Proven experience in developing and executing data strategies aligned with business objectives.
* Ability to communicate a compelling vision and gain organizational buy-in for data initiatives.
* Ability to drive transformational change across the organization as it relates to Data.

**Data Architecture and Technology:**

* Strong expertise in designing and implementing scalable data architectures.
* Proficiency in data technologies, including Salesforce, Call Center data, databases, data warehouses/data lake, ETL tools, AI/ML

**Project Management:**

* Demonstrated success in leading complex data projects from conception to implementation.
* Strong project management skills with the ability to prioritize and manage multiple initiatives concurrently.

**Team Management:**

* Leadership experience in building and managing high-performing data teams.
* Ability to motivate and inspire team members to achieve ambitious goals.

**Communication and Collaboration:**

* Excellent communication skills with the ability to translate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
* Collaborative approach with a proven track record of working effectively across departments.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's or advanced degree in Computer Science, or a related field
* 10+ years of progressive experience in data functions, 5+ years of leadership experience in data management roles, demonstrating a consistent history of career advancement and professional growth.
* Proven track record of successful implementation of data transformation in the healthcare sector.
* Proven experience in designing and implementing data solutions including AI/ML models.
* Proven ability to inspire, lead and develop high-performing teams.
* Strong understanding of the healthcare landscape, data structures, data modeling and data governance
* Strong understanding of a Call Center, BPO driven business
* Ability to effectively communicate complex data-related concepts to a wide range of stakeholders.
* Knowledge of healthcare Information security regulations and standards related to data usage and privacy as well as HIPAA/HITRUST compliance standards.

**Key technology and skill proficiencies:**

* MS Azure Cloud data architecture (data Lake, data warehouse, database)
* Salesforce Cloud
* CCaaS familiarity – understanding of call center business data.
* Sales data and process efficiency (through Salesforce and HubSpot today)
* Healthcare/Carrier integration experience
* Sage intact or equivalent financial management solution data familiarity
* Boomi / MuleSoft or equivalent EDI platform- 834 file experience a plus.
* Tableau, Power BI
* OpenAI

**Responsibilities:**

* This role will drive the strategic application of data across the organization.
* Employing a comprehensive data strategy, the VP of Data Management will enable the organization to engage the right stakeholder at the right time, resulting in improved outcomes.
* Leading the strategic planning, development, and implementation of a data strategy, encompassing AI and ML initiatives, data governance and data management to achieve RetireeFirst mission and objectives.
* Working with and supporting a high-performing team of data professionals, fostering a culture of innovation and continuous learning.
* Collaborating with key stakeholders across the organization to optimize the use of data in enhancing outcomes and driving efficiencies.
* As part of the overall data transformation, find ways to optimize our use of Salesforce as part of the modern data architecture and create a future vision for how data is stored, processed, and transmitted.
* Enhance the EDI function for better redundancy and efficiency as it continues to grow into a mission critical service.

If you are a visionary, hands-on, leader with a passion for data-driven decision-making and a proven track record of transforming data into a strategic asset, we invite you to apply for this exciting opportunity. Join RetireeFirst and be a driving force in shaping the future of our data ecosystem.

title: SQL DBA
description:
**Job Title- Sql DBA  
Duration- Contract (03 Months to start)  
Location:** **Philadelphia** **PA** (**Remote) with in 100 miles**

 

**Job Description**

· Seniority Level/Target years of experience: 

· Top 3-5 Technical Skills – Please enter in sentence format for ease use by RDMs

· SQL backend DBA

· \*ETL experience/transactions into the backend

· \*strong soft skills/ tech chop combo to engage the biz and IT

 

· At least 5 years of experience in administration and management of database platforms and application backend infrastructure

· Expertise in MS SQL Server platform and modules, including SSRS/PBIRS, ‘Always on’ clusters, ‘Replication’, and ‘Auditing’

· Working knowledge of Oracle platforms and products including Data guard

· Strong understanding of alternative SQL platforms and products including PostgreSQL, Sybase, AZURE DB, and MariaDB, Business Objects, Power BI, or similar

· Working knowledge of Data Warehousing concepts

title: Behavioral Health Technician
description:
WES Health System, a well-established community-based agency, serving a culturally diverse population in Philadelphia has temporary part-time openings in our School Therapeutic Services Programs. The Behavioral Health Worker may work up to 32.5 hours per week.

**GENERAL OVERVIEW OF KEY ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES:**

The Behavioral Health Worker meeting the requirements of a Therapeutic Staff Support, will implement specific school based behavioral plan, track measurable objectives, and communicate progress through notes, reports and supervision.

**ESSENTIAL & CORE FUNCTIONS:**

1. Provides mental health interventions to a range of consumers. Monitors consumers’ behaviors emphasizing prevention rather than intervention.

2. Assists teacher and or unique caregiver with implementation of behavioral plan.

3. Supervises/monitors activities of child/adolescent in accordance with the behavioral plan with the emphasis on prevention rather than intervention.

4. Intervenes as needed with problem behaviors that are exhibited, which includes but are not limited to counseling, removing them from the area, verbal prompts, securing the assistance of clinical staff, etc.

5. Prevents crisis situation however when necessary deescalate children in crisis.

6. Collaborates with school personnel, and unique caregivers as directed by the Clinician.

7. Completes and submits progress notes, encounter data, outcome data as required.

8. Attends and participates in supervision, family meeting and staff meetings.

9. Assists Clinician with groups.

10. Inputs outcome data into computer system.

11. Collects outcome data for consumers.

12. Follow-ups on all consumers needing hospitalization.

13. Completes all paperwork within specified time frames.

14. Adheres to WES’ Code of Ethics and comply with State Mental Health Code.

15. Attends trainings as required by WES.

16. Participates in continuous quality assurance and/or program development.

17. Complies with WES’ standards for service delivery.

18. Other duties and responsibilities as requested.

19. Performs assigned duties during the summer months when school is not in session.

20. Completes home and community visits.

 

**PREREQUISITES & QUALIFICATIONS FOR THE POSITION:**

1. Bachelor’s Degree from an accredited college or university in one of the following disciplines, which includes Psychology, Social Work, Sociology, Education, Criminal Justice or other Human Service field. If one of the above degrees is held, no work experience is required. If the worker is a Licensed Registered Nurse, 1 year verified full-time paid experience working in direct contact with children/adolescents is required. “Other Bachelor’s Degree requires 1 year verified full-time paid experience\* working in direct care with children/adolescents is required.  
  
**OR**

Associate’s Degree, 60 credits toward a Bachelor’s Degree or a Licensed Practical Nurse with three (3) years verified full-time paid work experience working in direct contact with children/adolescents is required.

\*Note that if a practicum was required for the degree, it cannot be counted as work.

\*Full-time work with children/adolescents means: MH, MR, early intervention, children & youth, juvenile justice system, education, drug & alcohol, daycare or health systems.

2. Knowledge of CASSP, community resources and managed care systems preferred.

3. Valid FBI clearance, criminal history check and child abuse history clearance required.

4. Participation in and completion of all CBH mandatory in-services (must be completed with three (3) months of hire and then annually from the date of the initial training).

**COMPETENCIES & PERSONAL CHARACTERISTICS**

1. Proficient in computer programs such as Microsoft Office, Excel, Word and PowerPoint.

2. Solid oral and written communication skills including business writing, proper grammar and spelling.

3. Good organization skills including the ability to prioritize work and manage conflicting deadlines.

4. The ability to work well with others.

5. The ability to handle conflicts with diplomacy and tact.

6. The ability to listen and evaluate objectively.

title: Installation/Service Coordinator
description:
We are seeking a Service Coordinator with a SMILE to join our team! You will be responsible for scheduling install/service appointments, resolving customer concerns. Provide Administrative Support with Sales, Installation Manager and Technicians.

title: Front Office Manager – 21.00/hr.
Senior Information Security Analyst
description:
6 month temp-to-perm. Salary range 91,000 -110,000 when transition to perm.   
 **Job Type****: Full-Time; hybrid (required to work in the office a minimum of 3 days per week)** In this role, you will be responsible for providing advanced technical support for the protection of information technology resources and confidential data across various systems. The Senior Information Security Analyst will report directly to the Corporate Director of Cyber Security and will execute security operations, participate in the evaluation, planning, and design of enterprise security architecture, lead implementation projects, and develop relevant policy and procedure. Works closely with the IT infrastructure, application teams, and business stake holders ensuring that they follow and fulfill cyber security best practices and remediate vulnerabilities and gaps. Engages in projects, requirements analysis, security solutions research, and implementation of security technologies, including the following: * Microsoft 365, Azure Security, and Windows user environment providing security strategy, security architecture assessments and reviews of enterprise projects.
* Governance, compliance, and auditing of security and privacy controls which includes HIPAA and NIST and other security/risk frameworks.
* Assess risk to the Acts information security architecture through the management and maintenance of security tools and services.
* Participate as a senior member of Security incident response team that manages mitigation and monitoring of internal and external threats.
* Develop and maintain table-top exercises, security awareness programs and training.
* Document, support and maintain Cyber security tools, policies, and audits.

**Requirements**  
The ideal candidate will meet the following requirements: * Undergraduate degree in Computer Science, Management of Information Systems Security, or Information Technology *(an equivalent combination of training and experience may be considered in lieu of degree)*
* **Minimum of 8-10 years of technology operations and security experience**
* CISSP or CISM or has earned equivalent certification.
* Achieved two or more certifications within the following categories: Microsoft Azure Security and Microsoft Azure Cloud
* Broad knowledge of Active Directory, networking, firewalls, endpoint protection solutions, log aggregation, data encryption, DLP, and other industry-standard techniques and practices
* Interest in growing into a leadership position.

Remote Data Entry
description:
Job Title: Remote Data Entry  
  
Company: LoneStar Voyages

Job Type: Full-time/Part-time (Remote)

About LoneStar Voyages:

LoneStar Voyages is a leading travel agency committed to providing exceptional travel experiences to our clients. With a focus on personalized service and unforgettable journeys, we strive to exceed expectations and create lasting memories for our clients.

Job Description:

As a Remote Data Entry Specialist at LoneStar Voyages, you will play a vital role in maintaining accurate and organized data related to client bookings, reservations, and travel itineraries. Working remotely, you will ensure the timely and accurate entry of data into our systems, contributing to the efficiency and effectiveness of our operations.

Responsibilities:

1. 
Data Entry: Enter and update client information, booking details, reservations, and other travel-related data into the company's database or management system accurately and efficiently.

3. 
Record Maintenance: Maintain and update databases and spreadsheets to ensure the accuracy and completeness of data, including verifying information, correcting errors, and resolving discrepancies.

5. 
Quality Assurance: Conduct regular reviews and audits of data entries to ensure compliance with company standards, policies, and procedures, and identify and correct any inaccuracies or inconsistencies.

7. 
Timely Processing: Ensure the timely processing of data entries to meet deadlines and support the smooth operation of client bookings, reservations, and travel arrangements.

9. 
Communication: Communicate effectively with team members and supervisors to provide updates on data entry progress, report any issues or challenges, and collaborate on solutions as needed.

11. 
Confidentiality: Maintain confidentiality and security of sensitive information and client data in accordance with company policies and data protection regulations.

13. 
Documentation: Prepare and maintain documentation, reports, and records related to data entry activities, including tracking sheets, error logs, and performance metrics.

15. 
Continuous Improvement: Identify opportunities for process improvements and efficiency gains in data entry procedures, systems, and workflows, and contribute to the implementation of solutions.


Benefits:

* Competitive salary package.
* Health, dental, and vision insurance options.
* Retirement savings plan (401k) with company matching.
* Paid time off and holidays.
* Opportunities for professional development and advancement within the company.
* Employee discounts on travel services and products.
* Positive and collaborative work environment within a passionate team of travel enthusiasts.

Qualifications:

1. 
High school diploma or equivalent; additional education or training in data entry, administrative assistance, or a related field is preferred.

3. 
Proven experience in data entry or administrative roles, with a high level of accuracy and attention to detail.

5. 
Proficiency in using data entry software, spreadsheets, and Microsoft Office Suite, with the ability to learn and adapt to new systems and technologies.

7. 
Excellent organizational and time management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.

9. 
Strong communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to effectively communicate and collaborate with team members remotely.

11. 
Self-motivated and disciplined, with the ability to work independently with minimal supervision and maintain productivity in a remote work setting.

13. 
Commitment to maintaining confidentiality and security of sensitive information and adhering to company policies and data protection regulations.

15. 
Attention to detail and problem-solving skills, with a focus on accuracy and efficiency in data entry processes.


Join our team at LoneStar Voyages and contribute to the success of our operations through accurate and efficient remote data entry!

title: Plant Manager - RTE - Meat Processing facility
description:
Position Summary:

The Plant Manager will oversee all plant operations ensuring adherence to policies and procedures; directly reporting to the facility’s Director of Operations. They will develop employees and processes that will maximize safety, quality, and productivity. Through direct reports, they will monitor and evaluate the production process and recommend methods to optimize product yields, equipment operation and process control while reducing waste. Engage all employees in continuous improvement and foster a positive work environment while developing a culture of ownership and accountability, including hiring, onboarding and team member development.

*Roles and Responsibilities:* 

• Planning, organizing, directing, and running optimum day-to-day operations to exceed our customers’ expectations

• Responsible for employee safety, food safety, production output, and product quality

• Implement strategies in alignment with company initiatives and provide a clear sense of direction and focus

• P&L responsibility

• Consistent monitoring of plant KPIs and providing corrective action(s) when KPIs are not met  Address employees’ issues or grievances

• Ensure all manufacturing areas comply with BRC and SQF requirements, and supports all plant food safety initiatives to ensure quality and food safety standards are being met.

• Manage a staff of direct reports through regular performance reviews and developmental activities to ensure movement toward a high performance / high engagement organization, while assuring effective departmental performance.

• Utilize available data (line speed target, set-up guidelines, and efficiency and process data) to continuously improve productivity, uptime and reliability.

• Utilize the above information as a tool to improve Overall Equipment Effectiveness (OEE) and product cost.

• Set clear priorities and align resources to deliver against business and regulatory requirements in the areas of safety, quality, financial controls, and business initiatives.

• Manage product quality by understanding and communicating customer needs to employees and ensuring expectations are consistently met and according to standard work.

• Determine schedules, sequences and assignments for work activities based on work priority, quantity of equipment and skill of personnel.

• Diagnose equipment, ingredients and packaging issues.

• Coordinate with Engineering, Maintenance or others as appropriate to solve production-related problems.

• Ensure each manufacturing area is maintained in accordance with BRC standards.

• Ensure security of employees, facilities and information systems by following and enforcing established security procedures.

• Ensure clear and concise communication to all levels in the organization.

• Ensure regular safety inspections are conducted in all manufacturing areas.

*Required Knowledge/Skills/Abilities:* 

• Leads with trust and integrity

• Effective listener and team player

• Strong knowledge of food manufacturing, FDA/USDA, OSHA and EPA regulations desired

• Able to work effectively with others, have good interpersonal and leadership skills

• Strong organizational and time management skills

• Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal

• Highly organized, critical thinker able to multi-task

• Able to work well under pressure in a fast paced environment

• Strong computer skills including experience with SAP and Microsoft Office.

• Continuous improvement and lean manufacturing mindset with the ability to lead and support multiple projects strongly preferred

*Education and Experience:* 

• Bachelor’s Degree in Meat/Agriculture Science, Supply Chain Management, Engineering, or related field preferred.

• 5-8 years in a management role (supervisor or above) within a manufacturing/food production environment

• Previous experience in Continuous Improvement / Lean environment Working Conditions

description:
**Job Title: Call Center Agent**

**Job Summary:**

We are seeking a dedicated and customer-focused Call Center Agent to join our dynamic team. The Call Center Agent will utilize their exceptional communication skills to handle inbound and outbound calls in a professional manner, addressing customer inquiries, resolving issues, and providing information about our products or services. title: Senior PPC Specialist (In Person)
description:
The Senior PPC Specialist will work with our website developers, content creators, and graphic designers to continuously develop and optimize SEO and pay-per-click (PPC) campaigns on Google Ads, Facebook, TikTok, and other platforms, focusing on conversions for our clients.

This position requires a demonstrated understanding of Search Engine Optimization, Search Engine Marketing, and Social Media Marketing. The key responsibilities will include campaign, ad, keyword creation, optimization, reporting, content creation, and A/B testing. The Digital Advertising Specialist must be detail-oriented, use good judgment, require minimal supervision, and be a problem-solver.

JOB DESCRIPTION:

* Management of advertising accounts on Facebook, Google, and other platforms.
* Maintenance and monitoring of keyword bids, daily and monthly budgets, audience targeting, geolocation, cost per conversion, and other vital metrics.
* Manage and maintain large target and negative keyword lists.
* Log and track changes to accounts.
* Help to improve conversions with collaboration on content and landing pages.
* Competitive analysis for client accounts.
* Design and execute strategies for ad copy, keyword opportunities, campaign structuring,
* targeting, retargeting, display ads, and other facets of paid search that align with client goals.
* Research and keep up to date with all PPC and social media advertising trends and developments.
* Conduct keyword research to drive content strategy.
* Improve expertise on Google, Bing, and Facebook products
* Create and maintain client PPC accounts on Google, Bing, & Facebook
* Ensure accurate monthly billing
* Consult directly with clients on their PPC strategy and execution
* Attend client meetings and consultations with Account Managers
* Create and maintain monthly client performance reports
* Attend monthly budgeting and strategy meetings for internal companies
* Manage PPC department requests and projects within the project management software
* Other duties as assigned.

QUALIFICATIONS:

* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment.
* 3+ Years of Google Ads experience – REQUIRED
* 3+ Years of experience in social media (Facebook/Instagram) advertising - REQUIRED
* Experience in data analysis and reporting.
* Detail oriented and analytical nature.
* Ability to learn new industries quickly and apply this knowledge
* Creative thinking and problem-solving.
* Passion for digital advertising.
* Project management skills.
* Presentation capabilities and comfort meeting with clients in person and by phone.
* Experience with e-commerce is a plus.
* Experience with TikTok is a plus.
* Experience with advertising automation platforms (Optmyzr, Opteo, SEM Rush, or similar tools) is a plus.

QUALIFICATION REQUIREMENTS:

The individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily and successfully. The requirements listed above represent the knowledge, skill, and ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions.

LANGUAGE SKILLS:

Ability to speak effectively before both large and small groups of employees, vendors and customers. Ability to write detailed financial reports, policies and procedures and routine reports and correspondences.

SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES:

None

The ability to work with all department teams and clients. The ability to use online computer networks with multiple and changing accounting software.

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to perform the essential functions of the job successfully. While performing this job's duties, the employee is regularly required to sit, stand, walk, talk, hear and reach with hands and fingers. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

WORK ENVIRONMENT:

The environment will mainly be in-office with some potential travel to meet with clients off-site. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

* Bachelor's Degree in Digital Marketing, Internet Marketing, or related experience

Salary position. 40 + hours per week.

title: Computer Repair Technician 2nd Shift 3:00 PM to 11:30 PM
description:
Sage is looking for a Computer Repair Technician to perform asset processing, detailed evaluation, upgrade, and critical data security functions. This position has the responsibility to bring out the highest value of the products, while also protecting any sensitive data stored on the systems.

Why Sage??Every team member makes the world a better place, every day. Our Mission is making the world more Sustainable by extending the life of electronics. Our clients are some of the largest enterprise technology users in the world, fueling rapid growth and numerous career opportunities to do well while doing good.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

Evaluates electronic assets and determines value based on physical and operational condition.

Performs data security on electronic assets.

Configures, upgrades and tests computer hardware and peripherals.

Inspects, classifies, diagnoses, evaluates, disassembles, and repairs computer hardware.

Evaluates and identifies hardware for specific disposition (resell, repair, harvest, recycle, etc.).

Upgrades products through the addition of new hardware.

Adjusts, repairs, and replaces worn or defective parts.

Works with Sales to evaluate the feasibility to repair and/or upgrade assets.

Enters detailed asset information into the ERP system that is not auto-populated by the data security software.

Evaluates inventory on hand to determine if parts are available for upgrade and/or repair. Submits orders for parts from inventory that are needed for upgrades or submit a request for parts that are not currently in stock.

Installs operating system (OS) to computer products per procedure.

Cross trains in all areas within Operations to ensure site flexibility and contribute to the development and ongoing improvement of the Operations systems and processes.

REQUIREMENTS:

Associate?s degree in a technology field, or equivalent experience

2+ years? experience working with hardware products, preferably in a repair related field

Strong computer literacy

Results oriented, team oriented, and excellent attention to detail

Ability to travel to other sites or customer locations (10% of time)

Ability to lift 50 lbs. or more

Working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite

Diagnostic and troubleshooting ability

BIOS configuration

Ability to configure, repair and/or upgrade electronic assets

Ability to identify and install pc hardware and peripherals

Ability to understand and carry out instructions furnished in various forms (written, oral or diagram)

Strong written, verbal, and comprehension communication skills

OUR PASSION IS YOUR OPPORTUNITY!

Our success with people directly impacts our success in meeting and surpassing our mission. Our investment in helping you to either further or start your career is essential to our success. So, if you?re serious we?re serious about investing in investing in your career in the ITAD Industry! Let?s connect and talk about your future!

Sage Sustainable Electronics is on a mission:

We're making the world more sustainable by extending the life of electronics.

In simple terms, this means better value, less waste and a smaller carbon footprint for businesses. We provide a full range of lifecycle services for every hardware platform from the desktop to the data center to mobility. We don?t recycle. In fact, we hate it. It?s contrary to our reuse mission. But when recycling is necessary, we are proud to be certified e-Stewards because we are uncompromising about the responsible e-waste management.

Sage Sustainable Electronics is an equal opportunity employer and fully supports and maintains compliance with all state, federal, and local regulations. Sage Sustainable Electronics does not discriminate against associates or applicants because of race, color, genetic information, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, ancestry, national origin, veteran status, military status, pregnancy, disability, marital status, familial status, or other characteristics protected by law. Professional development assistance

Technical Writer
description:
**Technical Writer**

Base Salary: $66,000-82,000. Position eligible for additional incentives including bonus, 401k match, health and welfare benefits.

Hybrid, Monday-Friday, 3-days onsite, or as needed.

The position can be based in either San Diego, CA (La Jolla/UTC) or Atlanta, GA (near the Braves Stadium)

If you are a talented Technical Writer with a passion for financial technology and a commitment to quality, we invite you to join our dynamic team. Take this opportunity to make a meaningful impact on the way financial transactions are managed and revolutionize the future of fintech. Our family of brands is seeking a skilled Technical Writer to join our Quality Assurance (QA) team. As part of this team, you will play a crucial role in ensuring the accuracy, consistency, and clarity of our documentation related to various financial products and platforms that span our five business finance brands. You will be an employee of our holding company and work with technology teams from all of the brands: National Funding, Inc., Quickbridge Funding, LLC., Finova Capital, LLC., Moneyjet and SmallBusinessLoans.com. This highly collaborative role will focus on creating and maintaining technical documentation that adheres to industry standards and regulatory requirements while maintaining consistency across this business ecosystem.

**General Summary:**

The Technical Writer plays a key role on the Quality Assurance (QA) team, Delivery Managers (DM) and Business Analysts (BA). The position ensures the accuracy, consistency, and clarity of our documentation related to various financial software products, platforms, overall definitions, processes and standards. Your primary focus will be on creating and maintaining technical documentation that adheres to industry standards and regulatory requirements.

**Key Responsibilities:**

Collaborate closely with software developers, delivery managers, and subject matter experts to understand and document technical specifications, functionalities, and processes related to our financial products and platforms.

Produce high-quality technical documentation, including user guides, API documentation, release notes, and system manuals, that effectively communicates complex information to diverse audiences, such as developers, end-users, and stakeholders.

Review and edit documentation to ensure accuracy, clarity, consistency, and adherence to company standards and guidelines. Conduct thorough quality assurance checks to identify and address any errors or inconsistencies.

Follow industry regulations, compliance standards, and best practices relevant to financial technology documentation. Ensure that all documentation complies with regulatory requirements and follows established procedures for data security and privacy.

Continuously evaluate and enhance documentation processes, tools, and templates to streamline content creation, improve documentation quality, and enhance the overall user experience.

Work closely with cross-functional teams, including software development, quality assurance, product management, and customer support, to gather feedback, address documentation needs, and contribute to product enhancements and improvements.

Maintain consistency in terminology, style, and tone across all documentation to reinforce the company's brand identity and enhance the user experience.

**Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Required:**

Bachelor's degree in English, Technical Writing, Computer Science, or a related field.

Proven experience as a technical writer in a software development or fintech environment, with a strong understanding of financial products and platforms.

Proficiency in documentation tools such as Adobe FrameMaker, MadCap Flare, or Atlassian Confluence.

Familiarity with Salesforce technology and experience documenting Salesforce-based applications is highly desirable.

Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to translate complex technical concepts into clear, concise, and user-friendly documentation.

Strong attention to detail and the ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.

Knowledge of regulatory compliance standards such as GDPR, PCI-DSS, or SOC 2 is a plus.

Certification in technical writing or related fields is advantageous.

**Physical Demands:**

Working in a temperature-controlled office environment

Sitting at a desk for long periods of time while viewing multiple computer screen monitors 

**Join Our Team:**

With over 25 years in business, SmallBusinessLoans and the related National Funding, Inc. businesses share a mission to help small business owners (SMBs) bridge financial gaps by providing simple, quick, and trustworthy loan options, without the hassle. As a company that believes in the impact of small businesses, we want to be the preferred partner that helps SMBs meet their immediate capital needs allowing them to thrive in the long run. As an innovative financial technology (fintech) company specializing in providing tailored solutions for managing financial transactions across multiple platforms and brands, you are joining a team of industry leaders. 

Apply now to be part of our innovative and growing organization.

title: Luxury Sales Professional
description:
A Sales Associate at CJ Charles Jewelers will be asked to achieve sales goals, while balancing daily business and High Jewelry sales. Sales Associates are responsible for developing a network and a loyal clientele. Sales Associates will attend social functions within the community to generate new business; invite current and prospective clients to in-boutique events and reach out through social media and other supports. Sales Associates are responsible for CRM initiatives – they are responsible for client data capture and accuracy, communication on novelties and events, gifting campaigns and clienteling reporting.  
  
 A Sales Associate is asked to assist in display set up each morning and display breakdown in the evening and help ensure products are stored safely nightly. They are to provide excellent customer service – following up on after sales service and follow the repair process from start to finish. They must work to ensure customer satisfaction. Sales Associate must follow all implemented Maison policies and procedures involving security, consignments, after sales services, and valuation requests. CJ Charles Jewelers Sales Associates are asked to share the quality standards and collection information with their clients and assist in maintaining the aesthetic quality of the Boutique.  
  
 A Sales Associate is required to have a strong understanding of Customer Services needs and customer priorities, excellent computer skills and strong attention to detail with the ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously. A Sales Associate needs to have the ability to establish and maintain effective relationships with customers and gain their trust and respect – excellent interpersonal and communication skills are a must. At this time, we are not sponsoring work visas. Applicants must have valid work authorization for employment is the USA.  
  
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES  
  
Sales Achievement:  
  
• Consistently achieve and/or exceed the monthly sales targets.  
  
• Ensure that each client receives outstanding and exceptional customer service by providing a friendly environment which includes greeting and acknowledging every customer, maintaining outstanding standards, solid product knowledge and all other components of Customer Service before, during and after sales client  
  
• Adapt approach according to the client needs and motivations • Negotiate and handle objections with ease  
  
• Assist and support after sales service.  
  
• Remain current on industry news and competitors  
  
 Client Relationship Management:  
  
• Cultivate new and existing client relationships through exceptional service, partnering with Management to develop a plan for their clients and prospects  
  
• Consistently and accurately capture client data for follow-up and relationship building effectively  
  
• Appropriately resolve client issues/concerns and escalate as needed to Management  
  
• Client networking events  
  
Daily Operations:  
  
• Understand and comply with all security and operational policies and procedures of CJ Charles Jewelers  
  
• Assist with daily set-up and breakdown of the boutique  
  
• Assist in the merchandising and daily maintenance of displays and back-stock  
  
• Actively participate in inventories  
  
• Assist with special projects (i.e. price changes, supporting back office responsibilities, shipping/receiving, inventory, etc.)  
  
KEY SKILLS Education:  
  
• College degree preferred  
  
• GIA courses  
  
Required Experience:  
  
• 2 to 5 years of previous experience in luxury retail, service or hospitality environment  
  
• General knowledge of jewelry & watches  
  
Technical Skills:  
  
• Ability to work in a fast-paced retail store environment  
  
• Computer and internet Savvy  
  
• MS Office experience required  
  
Personal Skills/Abilities:  
  
• Additional language skills are a plus  
  
• Excellent interpersonal and communication skills are required  
  
• Strong understanding of Customer Service needs  
  
• Strong attention to detail with the ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously and with precision  
  
 Being an Ambassador of CJ Charles Jewelers:  
  
• Uphold CJ Charles image by maintaining professional demeanor at all times  
  
• Self-Starter with Team-Player approach  
  
• Must be available to work retail hours including weekends/nights and to travel for trainings, client events, conferences…

title: Security Installer II
description:
Description:We are looking for a hard-working professional that takes pride in their work and the company they work for. This is an immediate need for security technicians, and service technicians. If this is you, then apply and join a team of field service installation professionals.

  


BLUENOSEiT is a veteran owned and operated full-service general & Low Voltage contractor specializing in smart + secure systems integration and critical buildings/infrastructure construction projects with over 20 years of professional experience in Planning, Design-Build, and Design-Bid-Build Construction. Proudly Veteran owned and operated, we run our business on the same principles that we upheld while in the military: Loyalty, Confidence, and Intelligence. We combine personal service, attention to detail, and the flexibility of a local small business with the depth and experience of a large contractor. While our military   
background, skilled technical experience and building systems integration knowledge allows us to provide clients with the best project solutions, it's our commitment to quality and safety that allows us to provide clients with fair cost, high value, and on-time delivery.   
  
**Access Control Technician – Security Systems Service Technician**

* Install / program CCTV, Cameras, Access Control, and Intrusion hardware.
* Assist in testing installed equipment and provide basic programming.
* Assist in troubleshooting, diagnosing, and repairing systems and/or equipment.
* Responsible for updating the team lead on the status of all work performed daily.
* Notify the team leads daily of any materials needed to complete duties.
* Perform additional Security Technician and related functions as assigned by the team lead and deemed within the general skill and ability level of a productive Security Technician in our industry.

  
BLUENOSEiT is an equal opportunity employer. We will not unlawfully discriminate against qualified applicants or employees with respect to any terms and conditions of employment based upon actual or perceived race, color, creed, religion, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, age, sex or gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, related medical conditions and lactation), gender identity or gender expression (including transgender status), sexual orientation, marital status, military service and veteran status, disability, protected medical condition as defined by applicable state or local law, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws and ordinances (Protected Classifications). When legally required, BLUENOSEiT will reasonably accommodate employees and applicants with disabilities, if the person is otherwise qualified to perform all the essential functions of the position safely and competently.  
  


Requirements:  


**Job Skills & Qualities Required:**

* Display a positive attitude to fellow team members and clients.
* Willingness and ability to be a team player.
* Ability to focus and complete assigned tasks and prioritize when given multiple tasks.
* Organizational, analytical, and detail-oriented abilities.
* Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, time-sensitive environment.
* Strong communication skills, attention to detail and follow through.

**Educational/Experience Requirements:**

* Experience in CCTV, Cameras, Access Control, Alarm & Intrusion, installation & programming.
* Experience with brands such as Lenel, Avigilon, Software house, Hanwha.
* Certifications like Hirsch Velocity, Lenel, CCure, Avigilon, and Milestone are desired.
* Required to adhere to OSHA Safety Standards.
* All employees will be required to pass all background checks, motor vehicle record checks, and drug screenings.

**Additional Job Description Information:**

* Installing, maintaining, and repairing cable infrastructure in a new construction commercial environment such as Hospitals, Data Centers, Airports, and Commercial Retail facilities.
* Performing maintenance on existing cabling systems, and on tenant improvement projects.
* Testing newly installed or relocated cables according to company specifications.
* Identifying and removing redundant cabling.
* Installation of wireless access routers, patch panels, and internet technology devices.
* Perform and learn how to properly deal with troubleshooting issues per company standards.
* Installing cable support structures such as j-hooks, cable racks, and inner-duct.
* Repairing cable termination, and cable runs.
* Ensuring all cables are neatly tied and bundled according to safety regulations.
* Completing paperwork such as timesheets, and checklists.

  
  
**Compensation details:** 30-35 Hourly Wage

title: CSDO Data Scientist - MUST BE A US CITIZEN
description:
**Purpose**  
Solvere Technical has an immediate need for an onsite Data Scientist based in San Diego County CA.

**MUST be a US citizen**

**MUST reside in San Diego County**

**MUST have an IAT II certification.** 

 

**Job Description**

At Solvere Technical, we rely on insightful data to power our systems and solutions. We’re seeking an experienced data scientist to deliver insights on a daily basis. The ideal candidate will have mathematical and statistical expertise, along with natural curiosity and a creative mind. While mining, interpreting, and cleaning our data, this person will be relied on to ask questions, connect the dots, and uncover hidden opportunities for realizing the data’s full potential. As part of a team of specialists, the data scientist will “slice and dice” data using various methods and create new visions for the future.

**Objectives of this role**

· Collaborate with product design and engineering teams to develop an understanding of needs

· Research and devise innovative statistical models for data analysis

· Communicate findings to all stakeholders

· Enable smarter business processes by using analytics for meaningful insights

· Keep current with technical and industry developments

**Responsibilities**

* Serve as lead data strategist to identify and integrate new datasets that can be leveraged through our product capabilities, and work closely with the engineering team in the development of data products
* Execute analytical experiments to help solve problems across various domains and industries
* Identify relevant data sources and sets to mine for client business needs, and collect large structured and unstructured datasets and variables
* Devise and utilize algorithms and models to mine big-data stores; perform data and error analysis to improve models; clean and validate data for uniformity and accuracy
* Analyze data for trends and patterns, and interpret data with clear objectives in mind
* Implement analytical models in production by collaborating with software developers and machine-learning engineers
* 

**Required skills and qualifications**

* **MUST be a US Citizen.**
* **MUST have an active CompTIA Security+ or equivalent certification.**
* **MUST reside in San Diego County.**
* **HIGHLY PREFFERED to have an Active IAT II**
* **Security clearance is desired or ability to acquire one asap.**
* Seven or more years of experience in data science
* Bachelor’s degree (or equivalent) in statistics, applied mathematics, or related discipline.
* Proficiency with data mining, mathematics, and statistical analysis
* Advanced experience in pattern recognition and predictive modeling
* Experience with Excel, PowerPoint, Tableau, SQL, and programming languages (ex: Java/Python, SAS)
* Ability to work effectively in a dynamic, research-oriented group that has several concurrent projects.

 

**Preferred skills and qualifications**

* Master’s degree (or equivalent) in statistics, applied mathematics, or related discipline.
* Two or more years of project management experience
* Professional certification

**Security Requirements**

* Must have an Active DOD Secret security clearance and the ability to maintain one.

**Travel Requirements**

* Occasional travel- 30% CONUS and OCONUS
* If position requires travel by domestic flight or access to secure federal facilities/military bases, candidate must be able to obtain (by start of position) and maintain appropriate identification credentials, such as REAL ID. (More information regarding REAL ID can be found: https://www.dhs.gov/real-id )

**Physical Requirements**

* Repeating motions that may include the bending down and up, wrists, hands and/or fingers.
* Light work that includes moving objects up to 20 pounds.

**Salary Range**

**$97,750-$143,750**

Please note: The annualized pay range referenced is a general guideline. Solvere Technical considers factors such as (but not limited to) the following when determining base pay: scope and responsibilities of the position, candidate’s related work experience, education/training/certifications, key skills, internal peer equity/external market competitiveness, as well as other business considerations.  
  
Additionally, Solvere Technical provides a variety of benefits to support your best health, wellness, and future, to include medical/dental/vision options, life and disability insurances, 401k with match, as well as company paid holidays and paid time off (PTO)
