title: Health Data Research Lead
description:
JOB TITLE: Health Data Research Lead 

REPORTS TO: Vice President PMO, OPS & QA 

DEPARTMENT: PMO 

HOURS: 40 Hours 

FLSA STATUS: Exempt 

EFFECTIVE DATE: Jan 2024 

SALARY: $120k -$150k 

 

 

POSITION SUMMARY: 

 

We are in search of a highly proficient and seasoned Health Data Research Lead to join our team. The ideal candidate should possess a robust research background and a thorough understanding of privacy and security policies and procedures applicable to Qualified Entities and their Participants in New York State. 

The preferred candidate will be proficient in qualitative data analysis software, coupled with competence in quantitative analysis and have the ability to independently craft intricate SQL queries for clinical data extraction. The candidate should be adept at translating ideas and concepts into communication tools suitable for various audiences ranging from public health initiatives to government agencies. 

Additionally, the candidate should bring experience in conducting research at the community level, especially in areas with complex socio-economic needs and health disparities. The ability to synthesize data and generate high-quality, publication-ready reports is a key requirement for this role. If you possess these qualifications and are ready to contribute to impactful health data research, we encourage you to apply. 

 

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: 

 

Research Expertise: 

* 
Demonstrate a proven track record in health data research, with the ability to design and conduct research studies. 

* 
Stay updated on the latest developments in health data research methodologies and trends. 


 

Privacy and Security: 

* 
Possess a thorough understanding of privacy and security policies and procedures for Qualified Entities and their Participants in New York State. 

* 
Ensure compliance with relevant regulations and guidelines to safeguard sensitive health information. 


 

SQL Proficiency: 

* 
Independently write complex SQL queries to extract clinical data efficiently. 

* 
Utilize SQL expertise to optimize data retrieval processes and ensure data accuracy. 


 

Data Analysis: 

* 
Analyze extracted clinical data to derive meaningful insights and contribute to research objectives. 

* 
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to interpret research findings and implications. 


Clinical Understanding: 

* 
Serve as a bridge between the technical and clinical aspects, understanding research requirements from a clinical perspective. 

* 
Collaborate with healthcare professionals to comprehend research needs and translate them into actionable data queries. 


 

SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES: 

* 
N/A 


 

 

QUALIFICATIONS: 

* 
Proven experience in health data research, with a minimum of 5 years in a similar role. 

* 
A minimum of a bachelor’s degree in health science, or relevant field advanced degree preferred. 

* 
Experience working with healthcare data including HL7, CCDAs, InterSystems HealthShare, and Cache databases. 

* 
Advanced working SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases, query authoring, and familiarity with a variety of databases. 

* 
Strong quantitative, analytical, process development, facilitation, and organizational skills required. 

* 
Must have prior experience in working on projects that have received approval from an Institutional Review Board (IRB) or QE Research Committee. 

* 
Excellent documentation and verbal communication skills. 

* 
Proficiency in writing complex SQL queries for data extraction. 

* 
Experience with Grant writing and management 

* 
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills. 

* 
Effective communication skills to convey complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.

title: Data Protection Architect
description:
Our client, a Manhattan-based financial services firm, is seeking a dynamic and enthusiastic Data Protection Architect to join their M365 Security team. As a Data Protection Architect reporting to the Security Architect, you will play a crucial role in designing, implementing, and managing data security and encryption solutions in a large-scale system and incorporating data protection into Microsoft 365 Copilot and allowing more B2B collaboration with data protection controls in place. This position offers an exciting opportunity to work with cloud and security technologies and Generative AI, ensuring the protection of sensitive data across on-premises and cloud-based infrastructure. **This is a daily rate contract only (C2C or W2), working M-F, from 9:00AM to 5:00PM EST. Local resources are preferred.**

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Collaborate with the Security Architect, M365 Security team, Data Governance teams, and business stakeholders to understand strategic objectives, technology needs, and emerging trends.
* Provide technical guidance for designing security capabilities in cloud
* Serve as an escalation point for security architecture decisions around data protection and ensure the integrity and security of information across multiple platforms.
* Design and implement data protection, encryption in transit, encryption at rest, Hardware Security Modules (HSM), cloud Key Management Services (KMS), cloud Data Loss Prevention (DLP), and cloud security compliance.
* Actively participate in the security and infrastructure communities within the organization.
* Contribute to the development of the cloud security roadmap for enterprise-level systems, ensuring alignment with the overall security strategy.

**Qualifications:**

**Required Qualifications:**

* Expert level experience in Microsoft Data Protection solutions is a must for this role.
* Expertise in Microsoft 365 Security and Microsoft Purview Information Protection (formerly known as Azure AIP).
* Expertise in Microsoft Defender for Cloud Apps.
* Experience with enterprise data security solutions, including Encryption, Hardware Security Modules (HSM), cloud Key Management Services (KMS), Data Loss Prevention (DLP), and key management.
* Experience with continuous integration and deployment tools.
* Familiarity with version control tools (e.g., Git).
* Proficiency in scripting and programming languages like Python, C#, PowerShell, or az cli.
* Bachelor’s Degree in Information Security, Business, Risk Management, Finance, Statistics, or related field.
* Strong knowledge of data governance frameworks, industry standards, and best practices.
* Proficiency in data management tools and data quality tools.
* Experience in data models and data architectures.
* Demonstrated leadership in implementing data protection processes at an enterprise scale.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Excellent communication skills and ability to distill insights for stakeholders and senior management.
* Strong leadership skills and adaptability in facing unique challenges while working with individuals from diverse cultures and business environments.
* Proactive mindset with the ability to think creatively to solve complex problems.
* Proven ability to work independently and multitask effectively, with strong analytical and conflict resolution skills.
* Excellent written and oral communication skills.
* Strong organizational and facilitation skills for meetings.
* Track record of successfully managing work to achieve milestones on time and within budget in a fast-paced environment.

**Strongly Preferred Qualifications:**

* 8 years of experience in Information Security, preferably in a highly regulated business environment.
* Certifications in CISSP, CISM, CRISC, are a plus.

If you are passionate about cloud and security technologies, have a proven track record in data protection, and are looking to make a significant impact on safeguarding sensitive data, we encourage you to apply for this role. Join this team and contribute to their mission of ensuring data integrity and security across the enterprise.

title: Insurance Coverage Attorney
description:
Insurance Coverage Attorney

GERBER CIANO KELLY BRADY LLP

Experience: 10+ years

End Date: 

Location: Garden City, New York

Top ranked law firm seeks a senior associate or junior partner with at least 10 years of experience in insurance coverage, reinsurance, regulatory, and compliance counseling and litigation. The successful candidate can work out of the firm’s Garden City, White Plains, Hartford, or Buffalo location. Some travel might be required. The candidate will be working with international recognized partners and work on complex challenging insurance and reinsurance legal issues.

This position requires a high level of motivation, flexibility, initiative, and accountability. The ideal candidate should have the ability to exercise good judgement in a variety of situations, with strong and professional communications skills, and be friendly and outgoing. The candidate will interact and work on matters across the firm’s footprint. This is an excellent opportunity for attorneys who are looking to expand their career and work within a firm of highly responsive partners, associates, and legal support staff.

Responsibilities include:

* Handling assigned caseload both independently and with supervision commensurate with experience
* Drafting of pleadings, motions and written discovery
* Depositions, court appearances and motion practice commensurate with experience
* Analyzing insurance policies and drafting insurance coverage opinions
* Communicate with clients and provide coverage recommendations
* Perform extensive legal research
* Maintain an excellent relationship with clients, including complying with all client guidelines
* Ensure all internal and external deadlines are met
* Accurately record and maintain billable hours

Required Skills/Qualifications:

* Exceptional writing, research and analytical skills. The ideal candidate must take pride in delivering error free product.
* Dedicated to professional growth
* Admitted to practice in the State of New York (PA, NJ and/or CT admission is a plus)
* Federal Court experience is a plus
* 10+ years of previous experience in the following areas are helpful: insurance coverage, insurance defense or similar insurance experience (reinsurance, regulatory), compliance and commercial litigation, data security and privacy

We cultivate a working environment that provides a humane, sustainable approach to earning a living and living in our world — for ourselves and for our clients. Further, we are committed to reducing our costs, and our footprint on the planet, by integrating virtually and avoiding the traditional “brick and mortar” costs associated with operating a law firm. We achieve this by ensuring that our team comes from diverse socio-economic, cultural, geographic, and educational backgrounds. We believe diversity is required to bring a variety of perspectives and approaches to our clients’ needs. 

Salary is commensurate with experience and skill set. Position offers benefits, including health, life, short-term and long-term disability, as well as 401k, flexible work and paid time off.

For New York City Applicants: Salary range: $35.00 - $70.00/hr. ($72,800 - $145,600), plus may be eligible for an annual discretionary bonus. The anticipated salary range is for candidates who will work in New York City. The salary offered to a successful candidate will depend upon the individual’s skills, experience, qualifications, and other job-related factors permitted by law. Gerber Ciano Kelly Brady, LLP, is a multi-state employer and this salary range may not reflect positions that work only in other states.

If you’re interested in becoming part of a truly collaborative team consistent with our mission, core value, business goals, and promises to each other, then your journey begins here.

title: Business Manager
description:
**Job Overview:**

We are an outpatient Behavioral Health Clinic seeking a highly skilled and experienced Business Manager to join our team. As the Business Manager, you will be responsible for overseeing the day-to-day operations of our company and ensuring its success. You will play a crucial role in managing various aspects of the business, including process improvement, compliance, HR, and strategic planning. If you are a dynamic leader with a strong business acumen, we would love to hear from you.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree in healthcare administration, business management, or a related field (Master's degree preferred). 5 years experience in healthcare management in lieu of education may also be considered.
* Proficiency in using electronic health record (EHR) systems.
* Excellent leadership and management skills, with the ability to motivate and develop a team.
* Strong organizational and problem-solving abilities, with attention to detail.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to effectively interact with staff, patients, and external stakeholders.
* Familiarity with compliance and regulatory requirements for behavioral health clinics.
* Ability to adapt to a fast-paced environment and handle multiple priorities.

**Minimum Experience:**

5 Years managerial experience

**Duties:**

* Strategic Planning: Developing and implementing business strategies and plans to achieve company goals. This involves analyzing market trends, identifying opportunities and risks, and making recommendations for growth and improvement.
* Front Desk Operations Management
* Supervise and train front desk staff, ensuring they have the necessary skills and knowledge to perform their duties effectively.
* Manage patient scheduling, check-in, and check-out processes to ensure smooth operations and minimal waiting times.
* Address patient concerns and complaints promptly, providing excellent customer service and maintaining a professional and welcoming atmosphere in the clinic.
* Human Resources Management:
* Manage the human resources function, including recruitment, onboarding, training, performance management, and employee relations.
* Develop and implement HR policies and procedures, ensuring compliance with employment laws and regulations.
* Oversee benefits administration, and employee records management.
* Staff Management and Development:
* Recruit, train, and supervise front desk staff, providing ongoing performance feedback, coaching, and professional development opportunities.
* Conduct regular performance evaluations and implement strategies to enhance staff productivity and job satisfaction.
* Foster a positive and inclusive work environment that encourages teamwork and collaboration.
* Business Development: Identifying and pursuing new business opportunities. This includes conducting market research, developing relationships with potential clients or partners, and participating in business negotiations to expand the company's customer base and market presence.
* Risk Management: Assessing and mitigating risks that may impact the business. Identifying potential risks, developing contingency plans, and implementing risk management strategies to protect the organization's interests.
* Stakeholder Management: Building and maintaining relationships with key stakeholders, such as customers, referral sources, investors, and regulatory authorities. Act as the point of contact and represent the company's interests in external communications and negotiations.
* Performance Monitoring and Reporting: Tracking key performance indicators (KPIs) and preparing regular reports to evaluate the business's performance. Analyze data, identify trends, and make recommendations for improvement to drive growth and profitability.
* Compliance and Regulatory Requirements:
* Stay updated on relevant laws, regulations, and industry standards pertaining to OMH and OASAS clinics, ensuring compliance in all aspects of clinic operations.
* Ensure patient confidentiality and data security by overseeing HIPAA compliance and maintaining proper documentation practices.
* Liaise with insurance providers, government agencies, and regulatory bodies as required.
* Ensure staff keep up with mandatory compliance training schedule.
* Continuous Improvement: Promoting a culture of continuous improvement within the organization. Encourage innovation, seek opportunities for process optimization, and implement best practices to enhance operational efficiency and drive business growth.
* Regularly meet with supervisor to discuss and resolve reimbursement issues, obstacles and clinic operations.
* Update job knowledge by participating in various educational opportunities, as requested by supervisor
* Other duties as assigned.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $45,000.00 - $65,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Parental leave

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Ability to Relocate:

* East New York, NY: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Security Engineering Manager
description:
**Taskrabbit will never use text or chat applications to conduct interviews. We have a thoughtful and interactive interview process that includes an initial recruiter phone screen and several video-based interviews with our hiring teams. Communications will always be conducted by taskrabbit.com domain names.**

**About Taskrabbit:**Taskrabbit is a marketplace platform that conveniently connects people with Taskers to handle everyday home to-do's, such as furniture assembly, handyman work, moving help, and much more.

At Taskrabbit, we want to transform lives one task at a time. As a company we celebrate innovation, inclusion and hard work. Our culture is collaborative, pragmatic, and fast-paced. We're looking for talented, entrepreneurially minded and data-driven people who also have a passion for helping people do what they love.

Together with IKEA, we're creating more opportunities for people to earn a consistent, meaningful income on their own terms by building lasting relationships with clients in communities around the world.

* Taskrabbit is a remote-first company with employees distributed across the US and EU
* 5-time Best Places to Work in 2022 by BuiltIn. Including Best Companies in SF, Best Mid-Sized Companies, and Best Benefits
* DataBird journal's "Best Places" Best Companies for Diversity, #1 2019 and 2020
* DataBird journal's "Best Places" Best Companies for Women, #4 2019 and #1 2020
**Taskrabbit will never use text or chat applications to conduct interviews. We have a thoughtful and interactive interview process that includes an initial recruiter phone screen and several video-based interviews with our hiring teams. Communications will always be conducted by taskrabbit.com domain names.**

* Taskrabbit is a remote-first company with employees distributed across the US and EU
* 5 time Best Places to Work in 2022 by BuiltIn. Including Best Companies in SF, Best Mid-Sized Companies, and Best Benefits
* DataBird journal's "Best Places" Best Companies for Diversity, #1 2019 and 2020
* DataBird journal's " Best Places" Best Companies for Women, #4 2019 and #1 2020

**You'll love working here because:*** 
+ Taskrabbit is a remote-first company. We value flexibility and choice but also stay committed to regular in-person connection.
+ The People. You will be surrounded by some of the most talented, supportive, smart, and kind leaders and teams -- people you can be proud to work with!
+ The Values.
- Care Deeply. We take time to be present and partner with our team and communities.
- Level Up. We navigate through ambiguity and go the extra mile.
- Be A Better Neighbor. We build a diverse and sustainable community and encourage all voices.
- Lead The Future Together. We value entrepreneurship and are inspired by action

+ The diverse culture. We believe that we make better decisions when our workforce reflects the diversity of the communities in which we operate. Women make up half of our leadership team and our diversity representation is above that of the tech industry average
+ The perks. Taskrabbit offers employee-paid health insurance, 401k match with immediate vesting, generous and flexible time off with 2 company-wide closure weeks, Taskrabbit product stipends, wellness + productivity + education stipends, IKEA discounts, reproductive health support, and more.

**About the Role**As the Security Engineering Manager at TaskRabbit, you will play a crucial role in safeguarding our platform and ensuring the privacy and security of our users' data. You will be responsible for managing a team of talented security engineers, developing and implementing security strategies, and enhancing our security posture. This role is ideal for someone who is passionate about building and leading security teams, implementing foundational security measures, and ensuring compliance with industry standards such as NIST.

**What You'll Work On:*** Team Development: Lead a team of security engineers, fostering a culture of collaboration, innovation, and continuous learning. Develop team members' skills and provide mentorship to nurture their growth.
* Security Tooling: Identify, evaluate, and implement foundational security tools and technologies to protect TaskRabbit's infrastructure and applications. Collaborate with the engineering teams to integrate security measures into the development lifecycle.
* Data Security: Enhance data security by developing and implementing data encryption, access controls, data protection strategies and data policies. Ensure the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of sensitive user data.
* Compliance: Maintain and improve TaskRabbit's compliance with industry standards, with a particular focus on NIST, and GDPR guidelines. Develop and execute compliance strategies and processes, conducting regular assessments and audits.
* Incident Response: Lead incident response efforts in case of security breaches, including investigation, containment, and resolution. Develop and maintain an incident response plan to minimize the impact of security incidents.
* Security Awareness: Promote a strong security culture within the organization. Conduct security training and awareness programs for employees, contractors, and stakeholders.
* Security Policy Development: Aligning with industry best practices and compliance requirements develop, update, and implement monitoring, reporting and preventing
* Risk Assessment: Identify and assess security risks and vulnerabilities, and work with cross-functional teams to mitigate these risks effectively.
* Continuous Improvement: Stay up-to-date with emerging security threats and technologies. Continuously improve TaskRabbit's security posture by implementing industry best practices and adopting new security measures.
* Develop and maintain Security KPIs, OKRs, roadmaps, and Security Strategy. Work with teams such as Legal, Data, Engineering, IT, Operations etc. to advocate for Security and align on planning.
* Represent, educate, and be a champion for security
* Define strategy for building preventions and threat modeling from the ground up with the team

Your Areas Of Expertise:* 7+ years of proven experience in building, managing and mentoring security teams.
* Proven ability to build and develop security teams
* Strong background in developing and implementing security strategies and measured metrics, KPIs and performance.
* 5+ years developing Security policies and standards company wide
* Extensive experience in establishing security frameworks, policies, and procedures to ensure the organization's security maturity
* Demonstrated expertise in implementing and managing security technologies and solutions to protect against emerging threats
* Track record of successfully leading security initiatives and driving cultural change to prioritize security within the organization
* Excellent communication and leadership skills to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams and stakeholders in promoting a security-first mindset
* Proactive approach to staying updated with the latest security trends and technologies, ensuring continuous improvement and adaptation to evolving threats.
* Experience building out a mature security program aligning to industry best practices and standards
* Familiarity with NIST guidelines and experience with regulatory compliance.
* Deep knowledge of data security, encryption, access controls, and secure coding practices.
* Experience with incident response and crisis management.
* Relevant certifications (e.g., CISSP, CISM, CISA) are preferred but not required.

**Compensation & Benefits:** At Taskrabbit, our approach to compensation is designed to be competitive, transparent and equitable. total compensation consists of base pay + bonus + benefits + perks.

The base pay range for this position is $142,000-$197,000. This range is representative of base pay only, and does not include any other total cash compensation amounts, such as company bonus or benefits. Final offer amounts may vary from the amounts listed above, and will be determined by factors including, but not limited to, relevant experience, qualifications, geography, and level.

**You'll love working here because:*** **Taskrabbit is a Remote-First Company.** We value flexibility and choice but also stay committed to regular in-person connection.
* **The People.** You will be surrounded by some of the most talented, supportive, smart, and kind leaders and teams -- people you can be proud to work with!
* **The Values.**
+ Care Deeply. We take time to be present and partner with our team and communities.
+ Level Up. We navigate through ambiguity and go the extra mile.
+ Be A Better Neighbor. We build a diverse and sustainable community and encourage all voices.
+ Lead The Future Together. We value entrepreneurship and are inspired by action.

* **The Diverse Culture.** We believe that we make better decisions when our workforce reflects the diversity of the communities in which we operate. Women make up half of our leadership team and our diversity representation is above that of the tech industry average.
* **The Perks.** Taskrabbit offers US employees employer-paid health insurance and a 401k match with immediate vesting. Taskrabbit offers EU employees medical insurance. We offer all of our global employees, generous and flexible time off with 2 company-wide closure weeks, Taskrabbit product stipends, wellness + productivity + education stipends, IKEA discounts, reproductive health support, and more. Benefits vary by country of employment.

**Taskrabbit's commitment to Diversity and Inclusion:**An Active Commitment to Equity within our Company and Platform.

We are an inclusive community where all who share our mission and values belong. Our anti-racist culture actively strengthens the knowledge, understanding, and awareness of underrepresented experiences and our ongoing allyship commitment. Our diverse team represents the communities we serve, breaking down systemic barriers, and transforming lives- one action at a time.

Taskrabbit is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military/veteran status, or disability status. Taskrabbit is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to applicants with physical and mental disabilities. 

Taskrabbit will consider for employment all qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with applicable law.

title: Security Guard
description:
**Title of Position:** Residential Aide **FLSA Status:** Non-Exempt 

**Department:** Security 

**Reports to:** Security Shift Supervisor 

**Positions reporting to this position:** None 

**Salary:** $16.70/hr

 

**Purpose of the Position:**

The Residential Aide is responsible for providing security and safety for all clients and staff. Ensures that all residents are observing site rules. 

 

**Responsibilities:** 

 · Maintain a secure and functional environment for residents, staff, visitors and volunteers; 

· Welcome new families that arrive and conduct orientation and provide house rules; 

· Handle incidents using standard operating procedures;

· Observe all residents and have the ability to recognize signs of substance abuse, child abuse and criminal activity; 

· Maintain excellent telephone skills and transfer calls appropriately;

· Acquire understanding of building features and potential problems; 

· Maintain daily log book, school attendance, visitor and resident sign-in logs; 

· Patrol transitional housing sites/apartments, maintain standing posts and conduct vertical patrols;

· Visit multiple units as required and report any and all incidents to the appropriate security shift supervisor;

· Attend program and agency staff meetings, house meetings and training sessions as required; 

· Work under pressure and during stressful situations;

· Use the computer to complete intakes and other reports on the CARES data base;

· Perform other duties as assigned by supervisor. 

 

**Essential Functions:** 

· Must be able to visually observe CCTV camera and report unusual activities. 

· Must be able to ascend/descend stairs in a building up to 8 flights. 

· Must be able to stand for two (2) hours on post consecutively.

· Must be able to lift and use a fire extinguisher. 

 

**Qualifications:** 

· Commitment to Win’s mission. 

· High School diploma or equivalent required. 

· Valid Fire Guard Certification / F02 required.

· Valid NYS Security Guard License required.

· Must be able to communicate effectively (verbally and in writing). 

· Must be able to interact effectively with the facility staff and client population. 

· Must be able to work well under pressure and during stressful situations. 

· Must be familiar with CCTV systems. 

· Must be willing and able to remain at post beyond regularly scheduled hours until appropriate relief arrives. 

· Must be able to work nights, weekends and holiday's as scheduled. 

 

**Core Competencies:** 

* **Leading Others:** Conducts informative, effective meetings with staff and communicates critical information clearly. Leads by example, doesn’t stay behind the desk; stays visible to staff and clients.
* **Facilitating Change:** Inspires and motivates others to achieve outstanding client outcomes. Assists in overcoming resistance to change. Anticipates challenges and manages consequences.
* **Managing Performance:** Participates actively in team meetings and communicates clients’ needs. Monitors performance against predetermined standards set by Win and funders. Shares constructive feedback, quickly and adjusts to new demands. Holds self and staff accountable for performing at high standards. Uses positive reinforcement to convey confidence in employees.
* **Applying and Developing Expertise:** Understands and upholds all policies and procedures described in Win’s Employee Handbook. Uses EBP practices consistently and effectively. Takes client issues to the appropriate people within the organization to obtain the most accurate information to meet the clients’ needs.
* **Communicating and Collaborating:** Values the full spectrum of diversity and inclusion for clients and staff. Communicates effectively verbally and in writing. Fosters open communication to and from the Assistant Vice President and supervisor.

 

 **WIN’S DIVERSITY, EQUITY & INCLUSION HIRING COMMITMENT** 

Our most effective service to our community comes from a diverse mix of minds, backgrounds and experience. As a result, we are committed to cultivating an inclusive work environment. Win actively seeks a diverse applicant pool and encourages candidates of all backgrounds to apply. We provide equal opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, color, age, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic disposition, neurodiversity, disability, veteran status or any other protected category under federal, state and local law.

title: Director of Program Outcomes and Analysis
description:
Asphalt Green is a non-profit organization focused on sports and fitness. We transform lives and build community through sports, fitness, and play for all.

Reporting to the Chief Operating Officer and collaborating with the Chief Program Officer on a project basis, the Director of Program Outcomes and Analysis will play a crucial role in ensuring the effectiveness and impact of Asphalt Green’s programs and services. This position will lead the development and implementation of comprehensive data collection through program evaluations, polls, and surveys, analysis, and reporting systems to measure success and organizational impact. The Director will also be responsible for utilizing data insights to inform senior leadership on a variety of strategic and operational matters.

**Responsibilities:**

* **Develop and implement a comprehensive program evaluation and survey framework:** This includes designing data collection tools and polls, establishing key metrics, and identifying indicators of program success and curriculum efficacy.
* **Lead the analysis of program data:** Utilize data visualization tools to analyze findings and identify trends, outcomes, and other impacts on participants, their families, and/or the community at-large.
* **Prepare reports and presentations**: Communicate key findings and insights from data analysis to senior leadership, coaches, and program staff.
* **Collaborate with program staff**: Work closely with staff to translate data insights into actionable recommendations for program, curriculum, and operational improvement, and coach development.
* **Develop and maintain data management systems:** Work with Asphalt Green’s existing data team to ensure the accuracy, integrity, and security of data.
* **Stay current with research and trends in program evaluation:** Conduct research on best practices in sport program evaluations and implement new methods to improve.
* **Develop data-driven insights and narratives for the Marketing department:** Utilize program outcomes and collaborate closely with the Marketing department to create compelling narratives that can effectively promote the organization.
* **Contribute to grant writing and funding proposals:** Work alongside Asphalt Green’s Development department to provide data insights and analysis to support grant proposals and program funding initiatives.
* **Perform other duties as assigned.**

**Qualifications:**

* Undergraduate degree in statistics, research methodology, program evaluation, or a related field required. Graduate degree preferred.
* Experience working with Salesforce preferred.
* Minimum of 5 years of experience in program evaluation and data analysis, preferably in the non-profit sector or youth development field.
* Must possess technical skills.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Proficient in statistical software and data visualization tools.

title: Cyber Security/ Network Engineer-Must speak Mandarin
description:
Network IT

Provide expert technical skills, guidance, direction, and leadership in regard to the firm’s selection and use of technologies. Lead the firms IT functions. Determine long-term needs and pursue purchases and contracts that will aid in accomplishing business objectives. Responsible for budgeting, strategic planning and forecasting. Rely on extensive knowledge and professional discretion to achieve goals. IT focus and specialize in the Broker Dealer business, client service and regulatory requirements. Hands on technically in all aspects of Network IT.

· Cybersecurity professionals - Develop and implement a comprehensive cybersecurity strategy and policies to protect an organization's digital assets. Design secure IT systems, networks, and applications. Continuously monitor network traffic, system logs, and security alerts for signs of suspicious or malicious activities. Manage user access to systems and data, ensuring that only authorized individuals have the appropriate permissions. Implement multi-factor authentication (MFA) and strong password policies. Identify and assess vulnerabilities in software, hardware, and configurations. Patch and remediate vulnerabilities in a timely manner. Conduct vulnerability assessments and penetration testing. Develop and maintain an incident response plan to address security incidents and data breaches. Ensure that the organization complies with relevant cybersecurity regulations and standards (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA, ISO 27001). Prepare for and participate in security audits and assessments. Perform security assessments, code reviews, and security testing on applications and systems. Evaluate and select security tools and technologies to enhance the security posture.

· Network Engineer- Implement and manage all systems, applications, security and network configurations. Expert in LAN/WAN systems to install internal and external networks. Test and evaluate network systems to eliminate problems and make improvements. Resolve network performance and network device related issues. Install upgrades, patches, new applications and equipment. Provide technical support and guidance to level1 support team. Monitor network performance and implements performance tuning when necessary.

· Enterprise Infrastructure Architect- Assess system requirements and ensure that systems can be integrated with existing applications. Design high level solutions for entire firms’ infrastructure needs. Ensure optimal performance for all systems. Offer support to other departments, as needed. Possess extensive knowledge of infrastructure, web and software applications. Rely on extensive knowledge and professional discretion to achieve goals. Report to senior management.

· Information Security Administrator- Implement network security policies, protect network from unauthorized access, monitor network usage and resolves access issues. Understand and execute security practices according to regulatory bodies. Capture and maintain log data for analysis. Lead manager for regulatory, internal/external and yearly audits. Follow backup retention policies and procedures according to regulatory requirements.

· Firewall Engineer- Install, support and maintain firewall and other security hardware and software infrastructure according to industry best practices, including firewalls, intrusion detection and prevention devices, and VPN concentrators. Diagnose advanced problems and solve issues, often under time constraints. Manage and configure firewall/security systems by establishing and enforcing policies; defining and monitoring access.

· Business Continuity Administrator– Provide expertise in evaluating facility continuity of operations planning with a focus on policies, plans, procedures, training, equipment, and organizational response to a wide variety of business interruptions. Assist in the development, implementation, testing, and maintenance of the continuity of operations program. Develop continuity tests, trainings, and exercises including SFIMA testing as well as internal testing with employees. Identifies personnel needed to implement plan.

· Technical Writer- Write, edit and package a variety of technical documents, including proposals, reports and manuals. Rely on established guidelines and instructions to perform daily job functions. Maintain records and files of work and revisions. Edit, standardize, or make changes to material prepared by other writers or personnel. Review published materials and recommend revisions or changes in scope, format, content, and methods of reproduction and binding.

· IT Project Manager- Run complex projects from design and development to production. Define requirements and plan project lifecycle deployment. Define resources and schedule for project/program implementation. Create strategies for risk mitigation and contingency planning. Efficiently identify and solve project issues.

· Data Center Supervisor-Responsible for the functionality of the entire Data Center. Which includes Power requirements, HVAC cooling and CRAC unites, chiller plant, UPS and Generator. Point of contact and leas with vendors for installations of related equipment, failover outages and new scopes of work. BMS system support for Datacenter related equipment and environmental. All structured cabling needs: design, installation and decision.

 

Network Engineer, Enterprise Infrastructure Architect, Information Security Administrator, Firewall Engineer, Business Continuity Administrator, Technical Writer, IT Project Manager, Data Center Supervisor,

Within the defined area of responsibility ensure the following as it pertains to the position and where applicable:

**Risk Management**:

· Perform due diligence in daily job to monitor risks and to prevent risk events from occurring. Manage daily responsibilities within risk governance framework, and policies and procedures of the firm. Take responsibility for identifying and reporting any risks.

· Possesses the appropriate risk management and internal control capabilities/skill set for the position.

**Compliance & AML:**

· Perform daily role in line with the Company's policies, procedures, WSPs and in compliance with applicable rules, laws and regulations to avoid and/or mitigate any regulatory risks.

 

· Broker Dealer infrastructure expert in connectivity and IT needs,

· Expert in the proprietary TSS Fixed income clearing platform.

title: HRIS Manager
description:
**HRIS Specialist**

**Queens, NY (on-site)**

**Overview:**

LHH is looking for a HR Specialist for our client, a leading global logistics company. This is a 100% on-site, in person role located at their US headquarters in Queens, NY. As the HRIS Specialist, you will play a pivotal role in managing and maintaining our HRIS to ensure accurate and efficient data management and reporting. You will collaborate closely with HR team members, IT professionals, and other stakeholders to support the implementation, enhancement, and utilization of HR systems and technologies. The ideal candidate will possess strong technical skills, analytical abilities, and a deep understanding of HR processes to drive continuous improvement initiatives. This position will compensate between $80,000 - $90,000, contingent on experience.

**Responsibilities**

* 
Administer and maintain the HRIS database, including data entry, data integrity checks, and system updates and reporting.

* 
Provide technical support and troubleshooting assistance to end-users regarding HRIS functionality, system errors, and data discrepancies.

* 
Generate and distribute standard and ad-hoc reports using HRIS data to support HR analytics, workforce planning, and decision-making processes.

* 
Conduct regular audits of HR data to identify inconsistencies, errors, and compliance issues, and implement corrective actions as needed.

* 
Stay current on emerging trends and best practices in HR technology and make recommendations for system improvements and innovations.

* 
Ensure data security and confidentiality by implementing appropriate access controls, data encryption, and compliance measures.


**Qualifications:**

* 
3+ years of experience in HRIS administration, configuration, and support, preferably in a global or multi-location environment.

* 
Proficiency in HRIS platforms such as Workday, SAP SuccessFactors, Oracle HCM, or similar systems.

* 
Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret data, identify trends, and generate meaningful insights.

* 
Excellent communication skills with the ability to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.

* 
Detail-oriented mindset with a focus on data accuracy, quality, and compliance.

* 
Proven ability to manage multiple priorities and adapt to changing business needs in a fast-paced environment.


  
  
**Pay Details:** $40.00 to $45.00 per hour  
  
**Search managed by:** Matthew Doman   
  
Benefit offerings available for our associates include medical, dental, vision, life insurance, short-term disability, additional voluntary benefits, EAP program, commuter benefits and a 401K plan. Our benefit offerings provide employees the flexibility to choose the type of coverage that meets their individual needs. In addition, our associates may be eligible for paid leave including Paid Sick Leave or any other paid leave required by Federal, State, or local law, as well as Holiday pay where applicable.   
  
Equal Opportunity Employer/Veterans/Disabled  
  
To read our Candidate Privacy Information Statement, which explains how we will use your information, please navigate to https://www.lhh.com/us/en/candidate-privacy  
  
The Company will consider qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records subject to federal contractor requirements and/or security clearance requirements.

title: Inside Distributor Sales Representative
description:
**BASIC FUNCTIONS**

As an Inside Distributor Sales Representative at Blue Raven Solutions, you play at pivotal role in ensuring our customers receive exceptional service and support. This entry-level position is designed for individuals with a passion for sales, excellent communication skills, and a positive attitude. Your primary responsibilities include quoting prices for in-stock items, managing a designated customer base, responding to heavy email and phone inquiries, and processing sales orders with precision. This individual has the responsibility and authority to carry out assigned tasks.

**SPECIFIC DUTIES**

· Support the creation/building of long-term relationship with customers.

· Performs order entry, reviews and processes orders, and create credit requests.

· Create processes and maintain a variety of reports pertaining to specific clients.

· Provide timely and accurate quotes for in-stock items.

· Respond promptly to heavy email and phone activity, demonstrating a positive, friendly, and helpful attitude in all customer interactions.

· Manage a defined customer base, establishing and maintaining strong relationships by proactively addressing customer needs and providing tailored solutions.

· Efficiently process sales orders, ensuring accuracy and timely delivery while collaborating with various teams.

· Interfaces with clients, account managers and internal departments to assist in resolving client-related administrative issues.

· Identifies delays or problem areas, and suggests solutions for resolving issues.

· Gather competitive information, and provide feedback on customer satisfaction, as well as recommendations to improve procedures.

· Provide essential administrative support to the sales team.

· Maintain customer database.

· Help track individual customer quality and delivery ratings.

· Comply with all customer quality requirements.

· Support a safe work environment, using safety equipment, ensure safety equipment used in the areas is proper, safe, and used in a productive manner.

· Follow established departmental policies, procedures, objectives, and safety standards.

· Perform other related duties and personnel backups as assigned and contributes to team effort.

**STANDARD REQUIREMENTS**

Comply with all requirements of International Standard ISO9001 and ISO27001, NIST 800-171, CMMC – Cyber Security and Informational Data Security Requirements. Aerospace Management System Standards AS9100, AS9120, IDEA-QMS-9090, ASA-100 and supporting construct standards AS6081, IDEA-STD-1010, AC7402-CAAP, CCAP-101, FAA AC00-56, ANSI/ESD S20.20. All employees shall commit and comply with the requirements of AS5553 for Counterfeit Electrical, Electronic and Electromechanical (EEE) Parts – Avoidance, Detection, Mitigation and Disposition practices.

**EDUCATION / EXPERIENCE / COMPENTENCY**

· High School Diploma – College education preferred.

· Strong Microsoft Outlook skills

· Strong attention to detail.

· Strong follow-up and closing skills to drive sales opportunities to completion.

· Customer empathy/ Superior customer service skills.

· Highly organized.

Salary: $60,000.00 - $75,000.00 per year

title: Staffing Coordinator (2-5 years experience)
description:
**POSITION SUMMARY:**

Coordinate continuous home care services, for the clients with the assignment of the Home Health Aides who have fulfilled all necessary contractual and regulatory requirements, ie. In-service training (State, Federal, and contractual regulations). Ensure that the Home Health Aides are properly instructed about the specific needs of the client and that services are provided as prescribed by the client’s Plan of Care. Track aides’ services and collect and maintain time reports.

**JOB DESCRIPTION**

* Understand the day-to-day operations as it relates to the coordination of patient care in a home setting.
* Ability to define problems and tasks, collect data and establish facts, take action and facilitate resolve.
* Ability to perform various computer functions, assisting with communication between departments and overall office operations.
* Knowledge in use of the following office equipment: Computer, Telephone, Copy Machine and Fax.
* Performs related duties as required and assigned by Team Leader, Director of Patient Services and Director of Operations.
* Demonstrates a commitment to maintain a high degree of patient satisfaction and strives to work as a team player with the other coordinators.
* Reports major incidents to appropriate departments.

**RESPONSIBILITIES****:**.

1. Review and follow up on all messages distributed so that any issues or problems are resolved in a timely manner.

2. Assignment of qualified aides to patient cases. If necessary prompt replacement the day prior to or immediately if needed for the same day.

3. Effectively communicate and document all case related changes, incidents, issues.

4. Verify and document the HHAs’ scheduled attendance throughout the day.

5. Inform supervisor and Human Resources regarding corrective action for HHA as needed.

6. Maintain efficient methods of ensuring patient continuity of care.

7. Able to participate and promote a team environment.

8. Establish and maintain accurate reports ( ie. Availability, weekend and holiday coverage, replacement form and missed visits).

9. Report to the Team Leader, Coordinating Supervisor and Administrator to ensure the area cases are properly staffed.

10. Refer Home Health Aides with Clinical issues to the Director of Patient Services or designee.

11. Apply corrective action upon identification of HHA problematic issues related to the quality of patient care using the disciplinary matrix as a guideline.

12. Reviews compliance statistics to assure that all home care workers employment pre-requisites are current before assigning them to cases on an ongoing basis.

13. Strives to maintain consistency of care by assigning the same home care providers to the patient.

14. Receives all complaints made by care givers regarding working conditions, and personnel practices or policies, and works to resolve the complaint in the employee’s best interests in conjunction with management staff.

15. Respect patient and employee rights and privacy, ensures security of protected information, practices in an ethical manner and is compliant to the agency’s compliance program and privacy policies.

16. Answering and routing phone calls.

17. Perform general office duties.

18. Sorting/filing/scanning duty sheets.

19. Maintains a professional attitude and appearance.

20. Respect patient and employee rights and privacy, ensures security of protected information, practices in an ethical manner and is compliant to the agency’s compliance program and privacy policies.

21. Perform a variety of clerical and data entry tasks and all other duties as assigned by Team Leader and Coordination Supervisor.

22. Assists with On-Call as scheduled by Supervisor.

**WORK ENVIRONMENT****:** Works in an office environment with regular exposure to staff and patient elements and occasional stress.

**COGNITIVE REQUIREMENTS****:** Must work cooperatively with others, and perform a wide variety of complex and complete tasks involving office equipment and machinery.

**QUALIFICATIONS****:**

· High school diploma/ equivalency required. Two years of College preferred.

· Three years of general experience required, preferably in health care or related industry required. Supervisory experience preferred.

· Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite, HHA Exchange and Internet

· Excellent leadership and problem solving skills

· Able to maintain a scheduling system manually and date entry proficiency.

· Excellent organizational skills with attention to detail.

· Excellent interpersonal skills.

· Investigative ability, highly organized, self-motivated, takes initiative.

· Understands the regulations governing the home care field, related to Medicare, Medicaid and other insurance.

· Understanding of communicating effectively with employee, patients and their families, medical and community affiliates in order to develop positive relationships.

· Ability to communicate effectively both in the oral and written form.

· Adaptability to pressure.

· Good communication skills.

**FUNCTIONAL ABILITIES:**

· Must be able to read twelve point or larger type.

· Must be able to lift, stoop and bend effectively so as to be able to perform the above listed job functions.

· Must be able to hear adequately with no more than an amplifier on the phone and speak in a manner understood by most persons.

**CONFIDENTIALITY****: Agency records are maintained in a safe and secure area with specific access availability to ensure confidentiality. Agency records, files, documents and reports are the exclusive property of the Agency. Only authorized personnel will have access to clinical/financial/personnel records.**

**Responsibilities of this job position have clearance for access to the following confidential information:**

* **Employee files which include all employee care information, medical orders, assessments, and reassessments.**
* **Agency staff with access to computer files holds all information in strictest confidence in the processing, storage and discarding of all data. Only authorized personnel will have access to written and computer data information; Authorized personnel will be assigned passwords/access codes to computer files necessary to conduct their responsibilities. This job requires the accessing and viewing of confidential materials, up to and including.**

title: Controller
description:
What if I told you it is possible to find a Company that lived to educate, inspire and empower others while creating a family atmosphere that truly appreciates and respects their team? Would you apply? What if I threw in strong Company values, outstanding benefits, and the opportunity for you to make a tangible impact and feel appreciated?

See below for a feel of what the Company culture is (REALLY) like. Hint: it's amazing.

At Westcliff, we are constantly striving to be the best while valuing each of our team members as human beings and succeeding together!

Westcliff is a leader in innovative global education. We are respected for our transformative, technologically advanced programs and initiatives with a focus on excellence, social responsibility, and diversity. Our tagline – “Educate. Inspire, Empower.” – is a summary of our Mission Statement. As it suggests, the main focus of our University is to strive to enhance the opportunities of our students and employees to enjoy success through empowerment, as a result of their education and hard work.

With diversity and inclusion at the forefront of Westcliff’s core values, we promote a culture that celebrates diversity and inclusiveness regardless of, but not limited to, race, gender, sexual orientation, family status, religion, ethnicity, national origin, physical disability, veteran status, or age. By joining the Westcliff team, you’ll be playing a significant role in our growth, having an opportunity to put your personal touch on Westcliff’s progress as we grow and succeed together!

The **Controller** at Westcliff University reports to the CFO and is responsible for overseeing all accounting operations, management of financial statements in accordance with Generally Accepted Accounting Principles, and key processes such as banking, accounts payable and payroll. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in accounting, a service-oriented attitude, and experience implementing and scaling processes in a high growth environment.

Additional accountabilities include a relentless focus on accuracy, maintaining robust internal controls, leading employee development and retention, and implementing best practices. This position is responsible for performing both supervisory and hands-on day-to-day activities. By virtue of individual and team performance, this leader is a sought-out business partner.

**DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES**

**Accounting and Reporting**

Lead accounting for Westcliff University

– Maintain records in accordance with Generally Accepted Accounting Principles and lead the successful completion of the annual audit

– Direct and implement appropriate policies, systems and procedures necessary to ensure the company’s financial performance and results are reported accurately, timely and efficiently

– Produce financial statements and internal/external financial reporting in accordance with company timelines and business needs

– Manage and comply with local, state, and federal government reporting requirements and tax filings

Develop and maintain accounting policies and procedures, including but not limited to:

– Defining and enforcing key controls over financial and company operations, including appropriate segregations of duties (system and process)

– Ensuring balance sheet account reconciliations are completed on a pre-established calendar schedule and in accordance with company policies

– Implementing new company procedures and policy changes, as business conditions warrant

**Execute monthly/quarterly accounting close, including**

– Defined and timely recurring close schedule

– Journal entry posting, financial reporting, commentary and analysis

– Recurring diagnostics and variance reporting

– Checklists to ensure departmental compliance

Supervise the accounts payable and payroll functions

– Follow all appropriate audit, review and process functions in accordance with company policy

– Ensure that vendors and employees are paid timely and correctly

– Enhance AP and payroll efficiency through innovative process development and improvement

**Oversee banking and cash management**

– Serve as point of contact for our banking partners and internal customers on recurring account management inquiries

– Administer our merchant service platforms utilized to receive payments from students and partner affiliates

– Originate payments to institutional partners, including international transactions

**Internal controls**

– Implement procedures to ensure compliance with company controls and processes, including segregation of duties, company credit cards, and other platforms used by associates to procure services and generate company payments to external vendors

– Administer company Travel and Entertainment policies and related enforcement

– Coordinate and support audits; ensure timely and accurate readiness of financial information during audits

– Safeguard the company’s assets, be alert for situations that could compromise financial integrity

**Financial Systems Management**

– Collaborate with the technology team to optimize and administer financial systems, including efficient and accurate processing of banking transactions

– Implement best practices for financial processes, data security and financial system integrity

**Cross-functional Collaboration**

– Collaborate with departments such as finance and operations to streamline processes and enhance financial controls

Support company-wide profitability objectives

– Identify and execute opportunities to re-engineer and improve processes, improve efficiency or reduce costs such as AP automation and other workflow systems

– Provide ad-hoc analyses and accounting/financial support to business partners in support of financial and operational objectives

Support the development and execution of the annual budget and operating plan, and manage the capital spending approval process

Attend to internal and external client facing matters as necessary and maintain an awareness of variables which could affect or enhance service levels

Develop proactive strategies to improve processes or alleviate process gaps

Adjust support needs as necessary and in a timely manner

**Leadership and People Development**

Build an organizational culture and lead in a manner in which passion for excellence and continuous improvement is innate

Maintain a deep and ongoing understanding of staff performance throughout the department

Guide team in ensuring monthly tasks are completed accurately and timely

Maintain staffing coverage and related contingencies to ensure on-time delivery of services during periods of unexpected staff absences or transitions

Review department work product as appropriate

Identify organizational needs both current and future, and develop or adjust staff and related resources as necessary; align resources for growth within financial budgets

Act as a leader on key initiatives; organize and control projects to achieve plan

Assess effectiveness of processes, probe as needed; plan and implement improvements

Ensure employee work processes, roles/responsibilities, habits and payroll processes are executed according to policies and applicable wage and hour laws; review and approve payroll with strict adherence to deadlines for area of responsibility

**Education and Experience**

Experience leading/building an accounting organization in a mid-sized stand-alone company subject to the governance scope outlined in this job description; preference will be given to individuals who have built and scaled similar organizations

5-8 years’ experience leading responsibilities similar to those required for this position

Bachelor’s degree in accounting or equivalent related experience; professional certification, such as CPA (Certified Public Accountant) or CA (Chartered Accountant).

Familiarity with banking and merchant service accounts (e.g., PayPal, Braintree)

Experience in an automated AP workflow environment

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with attention to detail and accuracy

Excellent communication and interpersonal skills

Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment

Proven track record of successfully managing financial processes in a complex organizational setting

**Behaviors and Other Qualifications**

Hold oneself and team accountable for delivering on business goals; self-assigns ownership for initiatives around process improvements necessary to keep pace with growth; past experience driving results in such an environment, including proven leadership and change management skills on large scale

Anticipate needs across the company and manage department resources to provide timely and reliable service to internal and external customers; prioritize and communicate when workload or requests for support exceed departmental capacity

Demonstrate and model company values with internal and external customers

Excellent oral presentation and written communication skills; communicates well to non-technical users and balances being detail-oriented with seeing the bigger picture

Demonstrate awareness of variables which could affect employee retention and/or morale; is a leader in developing strategies to ensure employee engagement and retention

Excellent relationship skills with external and internal clients

Ability to work well under pressure and deadlines; committed to getting the job done

A strategic thinker; able to prioritize and use sound judgment and decision-making

**Equity Eligible:**

There are a variety of factors that go into determining a salary range, including but not limited to external market benchmark data, geographic location, and years of experience sought/required. The range for hiring in US is $150K-$170K/year DOE.

LIMITATIONS AND DISCLAIMER

*The above job description is meant to describe the general nature and level of work being performed; it is not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required for the position. All job requirements are subject to possible modification to reasonably accommodate individuals with disabilities. This job description in no way states or implies that these are the only duties to be performed by the employee occupying this position. Employees will be required to follow any other job- related instructions and to perform other job-related duties requested by their supervisor in compliance with Federal and State Laws. Requirements are representative of minimum levels of knowledge, skills and/or abilities. To perform this job successfully, the employee must possess the abilities or aptitudes to perform each duty proficiently. Continued employment remains on an at-will basis, unless otherwise contractually bound.*

Westcliff University is an Equal Opportunity Employer

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $150,000.00 - $170,000.00 per year

* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Employee discount
* Health insurance

* Paid sick time
* Paid time off

Experience level:

* 6 years
* 7 years
* 8 years

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

title: Senior Client Service Specialist (3 Years' Experience Required)
Technology Account Manager
description:
About C3 Tech: C3 Tech is an IT company and office technology provider in Santa Ana, California. C3 stands for Client-Centric Consulting because we are committed to giving each client incredible value, cutting-edge technology, and stellar customer support. As a leading organization in Orange County, we help drive local businesses forward by offering the highest quality copiers, printers, scanners, security cameras, wide-format printers, VoIP products, and an extensive suite of managed IT services.

We are women-led, minority-owned, DBE-certified, and ACDBE certified. Our diverse team of sales experts, IT gurus, and certified technicians create an exciting, positive work culture at C3 Tech. From the moment you step in the doors, you’ll notice the friendly atmosphere and exceptional people. As an authentic family of team-players and difference-makers, we work together to design unique solutions for all our clients. C3 Tech believes that each member offers unique insight, skills, and personality to our growing team. We welcome new ideas and strategies with open minds! Your success is truly our success, and we celebrate each victory together.

Position Summary: Technology Account Manager Are you seeking strong training and development? Our Leadership Training Program is just for you!

Exposure- You’ll meet with local Orange County business leaders at small to mid-size companies and learn to adjust your approach and tactics depending on the audience and industry. You will also be mentored by legends in the industry.

Sales- Smart prospecting, qualifying, sales funnel process, proposal building, closing, relationship building, account management. Train your sales skills to master any craft.

Product Knowledge – Become an industry expert on multiple lines of technology, solution selling strategies, and lock-out features for major manufacturers. Once graduated from our Leadership Training Program, you will have the opportunity to develop your unique career path within C3 Tech.

Role: The ideal candidate will possess strong interpersonal and organizational skills. They should be a self-starter who is comfortable with multitasking and be able to budget their resources to meet the assigned expectations for their role. They should be able to  
identify and develop new business opportunities in a protected territory while maintaining strong relationships with current customers and expanding our offerings.

Responsibilities  
• Build and maintain current client relationships  
• Develop relationships with new business opportunities  
• Track and record metrics throughout the sales process  
• Meet and exceed financial goals  
• Understand and keep up to date with industry and competitive landscape knowledge

Qualifications  
• 1-2 years of maintaining field relationships and business experience  
• Financially motivated  
• Passion for people and building relationships  
• Natural leadership qualities  
• Eager to build a career, not just have a job  
• Extremely self-motivated & organized with the ability to multitask  
• Strong written and verbal communication skills  
• Proficiency in Microsoft Office

• Entrepreneur approach and the ability to work independently and collaboratively

title: Dispatcher - Private Security - FT (Multiple Shifts)
description:
We are looking for a reliable **IN OFFICE** **Dispatch Security Officer** to act as a communication point for emergency and non-emergency calls. You must be able to multitask and take the appropriate action with little supervision. The goal is to enable different parties to communicate well by ensuring the accurate and timely transmission of information.  
  
***>>>PAYRATES: $20-25<<<***

***>>>INCLUDES WEEKENDS<<<***  
**Responsibilities**  
* Receive emergency and non-emergency calls and record significant information
* Address problems and requests by transmitting information or providing solutions
* Receive and dispatch orders for products or deliveries
* Prioritize calls according to urgency and importance
* Use radio, phone, or computer to send crews, vehicles, or other field units to appropriate locations
* Monitor the route and status of field units to coordinate and prioritize their schedule
* Provide field units with information about orders, traffic, obstacles, and requirements
* Enter data in the computer system and maintain logs and records of calls, activities, and other information
